Summary: What an absolute dump. Don’t come anywhere near here. Newish floors don’t make up for everything else that’s broken, dingy and filthy! A Motel 6 in the middle of nowhere would be better than this place

I found this little nest egg on priceline.com. It was stated as a 2-star hotel and I was doing my best to avoid it. Lol. I looked through some of the photos finally and thought to myself maybe it won't be that bad and booked it for the night. When I entered into the room, to my surprise, it was really nice! Everything was clean and had a classy feel to it! The night was peaceful and I needed it! Will definitely be booking again!!!!

At first I thought we weren't allowed in the lobby due to the time we checked in (1:30am) but the next day the lobby was still closed.. and with all the tweakers hanging around I now see why it's always closed. The staff was nice, bed in the room was comfy. We had to have the air on the whole time due to so much humidity. The shower head had absolutely  no pressure.  The toilet wouldn't flush properly and wasn't even level to the ground. The TV had a huge black line through it like someone tried to catch it on fire... maybe 4in wide. The remote was missing buttons and look like it had also been melted. Exchanged clean towels with the maid since we didn't want our room open while away due to the unregistered guests in the front grass area

Don’t go here at all costs. Homeless in the area, room was dirty, needed repairs, explicit comments from previous guests written on the wall, drawers. People roaming through the parking lot. All around bad.

Summary Heading: Can not believe this place is even open
Summary: The rooms are not clean with bugs everywhere.  Water pipe from the toilet broke and flooded my room.  Could not even get the manager to return my phone calls.  The pool is filthy.  No bargin at any price.
Room tip: There is no elevator so stay on the ground floor.

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY HERE YOU'LL REGRET IT
Summary: This was the worst motel I have ever stayed at in my entire life. I say motel because you couldnt even give this place the courtesy of calling it a hotel. Unless you like drug deal and shady people lingering around all hours or the day and night do not stay here. I wont even go into the fact that their so called housekeeping went in to clean my room while I was gone, moved everything around and then decided to eat their lunch in my room and leave all the wrappers and garbage for me to clean up. Went to the front desk about the issue and took the garbage and they didnt argue because obviously it was stuff from their employee kitchen. This place is the hotspot for drug dealers, addicts, homeless and all sorts of shady people. I had booked 7 days at this hotel because of the price

Forgot iPad in room & hotel staff kept it. When called they told me there is nothing they can do.  They can’t be trusted even though I gave them the address where the iPad was taken I’m quite sure they know which employee took iPad by address

For your own safety and sanity stay away!   We booked for 9 nights (big mistake) and checked out after 1. The person next to our room (who I can only assume either stays there often or lives there) was up all night blaring his music and smoking cigarettes right at his door as well as had sex workers coming in and out of his room. one of them literally came out of his room holding her bra and underwear to enter another car with another man.   There were drug transactions occurring in the parking lot.  There was a gentlemen a few meters away who was swaying in place, bending over and looked like he was vomiting.   The room stunk like moth balls, there were stains on the couch as well as cigarette burns. My friends room had bugs in the tub. And the list goes on.   When we vocalised

First night in the room zero hot water. Let the manager know. Still no hot water by the afternoon the next day. Had to go shower at a friend house that stayed 40mins from the area just to be clean before heading out.

Summary Heading: Very Run Down and Not Clean
Summary: This room was spacious and had two tables to sit at, but we were put next door to an adjoining room and everything could be heard through the adjoining door.  Was not quiet.  The room was dirty, both floor and countertops.  I had to clean them myself and even scrape what seemed like dried on jelly off the tops.  Very surprised with the name of Wyndham on it!!  Won't stay here again in the future.  Don't recommend to others.

Summary Heading: Alternative accommodations were quickly needed and ended up here
Summary: We needed alternative lodging accommodations quickly after another Wyndham property apparently gave our room away even though we had reservations and did a mobile check-in before we left home.  We had no room upon our arrival.  We quickly used our Wyndham mobile app to find that Travelodge was nearby and also nearby to our venue the next morning.  The staff at check-in were very helpful and got us a room that was better than what we were anticipating.  The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable which enabled us to get a good night sleep.    When we needed an extra pillow and a TV remote, they were brough to our room in less than 5 minutes!    We have no complaints!

Worst hotel I have ever stayed in my life. I have travelled to over 50 countries , absolutely the worst of the worst.  Traveloge Brand should be removed The new name should be Slumlord Pig Stye , and that is not fair to the Pigs.

Summary Heading: Less Homeless Hanging out - More Trash/Foil All Over the Property
Summary: Not so many homeless hanging out this time and no police presence this time. Trash was dug out of all the thrash cans and tossed ou and littered all over property, whoever did it was looking for drugs or foil to use for there drugs.

Staff refused to extens my stay because thr gurst below me complqined that u ran the water to shower at 3am.  When. I explained that I shouks be able?to showet when i want the staff was unreasonable ans walked away from me

Summary Heading: Dirty, old, unsanitary, dishonest management , STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE
Summary: Horrible experience, DO NOT STAY HERE. Really old and decrepit, Totally unsanitary room: dirty, broken parts in the shower, mold, towels stained with blood, room heat did not work, etc, etc.  Also, the took an additional $100 deposit in addition to the room charge and did not cancel it upon my checkout. This $100 charge hit my credit card bill and I'm now fighting them to have the charge reversed. TOTALLY DISHONEST business. Avoid at all costs

Stay  was good service friendly and quick the room was very roomie beautiful bathroom and very sleepable bed I really enjoyed my stay was treated like a family member I would recommend staying at this motel anytime

This place doesn't even get the basic maintenance done. You can tell from the moment you get on the property that you'll wish you had booked somewhere else. The walls are filthy - they haven't been painted (or cleaned) in years. The fixtures, draperies, and furniture inspire concern.

Summary Heading: They should knock it down and start over
Summary: Room furniture, electronics, microwave, beds, racks, bathroom tile, a/c unit, everything was in bad shape and taken out of service and replaced, falling apart and looks like then attitude of this hotel is as long as it is functional it’s good enough. They don’t care about guests feeling comfortable, if they did they would have kept rust off the fixtures, completed flooring  to where it at least touched the wall, replaced beds that were hard and springs were popping out. Had an actual working wifi signal. The drawers did open and shut and some water barely came out of the shower that had hair left in the tub so it wasn’t all bad!!!

Initial bed sheets were stained. Changed with blood stained sheets. Riff raft in parking lot and thought the walk way to rooms. Obvious prostitution and dugs. Gnat filled room. Surrounding noise night

Stayed here overnight with the family, the room was clean but everything was outdated and worn out.  We were disappointed that the pool was closed, there was no info on the website that is would be, no entry to the lobby or breakfast

great location to NP and HB, but clearly some shady business going on here, odd people knocking on doors and windows at all hours of the night, someone doing their vehicle breaks in the parking lot, people talking loudly at all hours of the night in the hallways.

Horrible motel. 1st room had pubs on towels/ bed second room smelled like dope smoke 3rd room tv remote was filthy disgusting and found a scale with white residue on it blah blah blah 200 characters minimum

Facility is old and worn out. Needs a complete makeover. I am a real estate developer and this place is in very poor condition. My room hadn't been serviced since the last occupant was a guest and I didn't arrive until 9:30 pm. I was moved to a different room which was clean but in very poor condition, especially the toilet/shower area.

DO NOT STAY HERE. We fell asleep only to wake up to noise from someone breaking in to our room! Would never recommend this place ever! It was a traumatic experience for my family. This place is disgusting restroom door didn’t even open.

The lady at the front desk was RUDE! BUT THE ROOM WAS CLEAN an nice. I was told the pool was open before i made my reservation over the phone. To be disappointed when we got there that the pool was closed. But New Port Beach was about a 5 min. Drive so that worked out pretty nice.

No cable television (what hotel doesnt have cable television?),tables falling apart, I'll stay somewhere else next time. Homeless people came into the breakfast room, ate, and left. Rock hard beds. Only good thing was the refrigerator/freezer

Summary Heading: Budget Hotel at a Convenient Location
Summary: This was my first time staying at a budget hotel in quite some time and I would stay at this hotel again if I vacation in the Anaheim area again in the future.  Convenient location, clean room and everything worked. Nice big flat screen TV and comfortable bed.   Enjoyed the jacuzzi.  Walking distance to several bars and restaurants.

Summary Heading: They let someone in my room
Summary: they let someone in my room that I never okayed or was notified.    This person contacted drug deals and stole my car.    Hotel manager is avoiding me.  And they said I’m not allowed to stay there.   NONE OF THIS IS MY FAULT.    I’m gonna move forward w lawsuit since they refuse to help.

The 1st night a couple fought off and on. When I brought it up to the desk they said they would have to get another complaint before doing anything about it. I’m pretty sure the people in the room were camped out doing drugs for days I was there.   Didnt sleep the 2nd night because some jackA$$ kept calling the rooms asking stupid questions. I was told to keep my phone off the hook after the desk attendant chuckled at the thought of such a prank. Ya thanks buddy.   Lots of transients coming through this property.

Not worth the money. Lots of homeless people near, staff is rude and incompetent.  It will be a loss of money! I checked out within 4 hours of checking in. The front staff was arguing with us and made us uncomfortable. We didn't even get out money back. This place made us feel unsafe.

Me and my friend stayed here for 4 nights. We felt extremely unsafe and unsanitary during our stay. There were dodgy characters in and around the hotel - smoking cigarettes/marijuana in and outside the rooms, making loud noises late at night and banging on doors/windows and lurking outside in the corridor. On our final night we called down to reception to inform them of loud banging and shouting happening next to our room, which then continued into the early hours of the morning. A window had been smashed during the night in a room next to us. It appears that some of these residents may be living in this motel. In terms of the room, it smelt strongly of smoke and lacked ventilation, causing all of our belongings to become damp and have a strong odour. Our bedsheets were stained

Hookers, people jumping in pool in the middle of the night, m80 was set off in the middle of the night, car alarms going off, room was never cleaned while we were out, when checking out we told the clerk about it, he said the night has no log of any disruptions during the night, how could he not have heard it

Summary Heading: Thin walls, freeway traffic is loud even late at night
Summary: If you get room facing the freeway exit you are doomed. You could literally hear the crosswalk signal noise beep and countdown if you are quiet enough. Motorcycles and cars actually speed off the exit and you can hear their exhaust. The walls were thin. Could hear the peoples conversation in the room next to us (then again they were loud). Could hear their door open and close throughout the night. Bed sheets had holes/rips and was not soft to the touch. Besides the floor the room is outdated. Room smelled like smoke although it was smoke free room. Lots more issues. But I’m done here. Wouldn’t go back nor recommend if quality sleep is what you seek.

It’s not breakfast they serve..it’s a snack breakfast. Toast coffe sweet bread and juice. Bathroom door hardware rusty. Bathroom walls dirty. Bed sheets had Black stains. Two flat pillows per bed. Laundry room was dirty only had two washers and dryers which only one washer worked (very dirty and old)

The bathroom dirty and dirty sower curtain no amenities and the front desk check in horrible No manager around for our complaints The continental breakfast was terrible A lot of homeless people and drug addicts hanging around construction in the back brought rats on to the property the night manager was feeding a homeless  drug addict with food from the kitchen which was connected to the front desk  People swimming late at night hallways dirty lots of noise

Bathroom exhaust fan didn’t work. Air-conditioner didn’t work when I first got there. Half a roll of toilet paper and bathroom.Dirty pool. Spa didn’t work. Exhaust fan in bathroom never worked. Ran out of breakfast first thing in the morning and had no coffee

From the initial check in the rude attendant did nothing but give me pushback about a specific request I made for 2 beds. It was pathetic. The so called breakfast was below school cafeteria food. I couldn't wait to leave.

This is not a decent hotel to spend your money on, upgrade to a better location and hotel. Grounds are dirty, rooms are dark and dingy, Food bar is like a vending machine. This hotel would be fine on route 66 in a old desert town in the middle of the night after driving for 12 hours but not in Newport Beach, CA

Room was ok, except the floors were very dirty. Air conditioner was very noisy and ran all night without much cooling. The staff was very helpful and nice. Jacuzzi was roped off and was not available.

Good helpful staff, clean rooms, stayed in the back lot, no noise, no people talking out side of your room. 4th of July was a pretty busy weekend also . Stayed 3 nights.. The breakfast room seemed a little small for the amount of quest having only 3 tables and a counter.

On the night I checked in, there was  baby roach in the bathroom.  It was very late and the room was clean, didn't smell and the beds were quite comfortable.  I considered changing at that point, but just kept the light on hoping it would keep others away.  When I woke the next morning there were 3, all small but of different sizes and figured eggs were in the process of hatching.  I called Wyndham Customer Service, made a complaint and they did manage to get me 1 night's credit.  I feel the whole stay should've been credited due to the inconvenience of having to now look for a new hotel.  Thankfully, Wyndham was able to get me a better hotel at a great rate.

Summary Heading: Awkward location, ok but not great
Summary: This hotel is in an awkward location to get in/out of as it is right where Hwy 55 ends and joins Newport Blvd. so you cannot easily get onto the street from the hotel. Hotel is very basic with old worn furniture but newer laminate floors. Pros: rooms large, tubs in bathroom, room was clean except for a very sticky spot on one nightstand, bed comfortable, pool area clean, Cons: windows didn’t open easily and had no screens, microwave cord would not reach plug—had to move micro to dresser and still have power strip dangling in the air or put micro on floor, fridge not plugged in on arrival so took a while to cool down and it had no freezer compartment, ventilation fan now working in bathroom, no extra pillow or blankets, overflow parking at adjacent motel, man standing in his room

Hotwire chose this hotel for us. Good value for the price. The location was excellent - close to roads and the beach. The building itself is old, and needs outside maintenance. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, and once the internet was repaired, it worked well.

Summary Heading: Sounds Like A Block Party ALL DAY
Summary: Pros: Great location near Newport Beach and plenty if eateries. Rooms are good size.   Cons: Way too much noise at pool and locals (I assume) staying there. Constant yelling and arguing going on. Was on the phone with customer service and they could barely hear me due to the noise coming from outside.   Conclusion: I wouldn't stay here again. Can get a much better quality room for price.

My stay was horrible. Saturday and Sunday night were the worst nights. I was on vacation and I could not sleep because the noise was ridiculously loud. When we told the staff the next morning all she said was oh there should have been staff here to deal with the noise complaint.  There were families downstairs in the swimming pool they were all drinking until three in the morning both Saturday and Sunday night. This was not a vacation for us we couldn’t sleep.  I am so disappointed with my stay. My mom owns a part of Wyndham and she will definitely be complaining.

The night clerk yelled, I mean physically yelled at me.  They overcharged me $514 and when my bank called to tell them what they had done wrong, they said the bank was wrong....the bank!!  The Asian receptionist told me "if you dont like our policies you can leave"....wow epic fail in Customer Service.

Too many suspicious and shady people on the property.  Unsafe feeling while out in the parking lot. Room needs to be renovated. Old looking. Stains on furniture in living room. We booked the suite.  Staff was the only positive aspect of hotel.

We stayed here on a school trip. Bad idea. Lots of druggies and other activities on the premises.   On the first night, several of the students were woken up at 2am by a druggie banging on their door. Spoke to the manager and informed him that we would call the cops if we had any other.  The next day, the place was very quiet.  Great place to stay if you're into partying and such. Do not stay with a family or on a school trip.

Nice hotel---clean, courteous, convenient to the beaches and shopping.  Will come back again!  Did not have any issues with security of my vehicle or contents....a plus!  Loved the keycard holder that had a local map and dining suggestions on it...great idea!!!!

My son and I came down for an UCI event.  Just a quick overnighter.  The price was good and it was close by so I booked it.  It is very much a motel style place.  Our room was clean enough (except that the chairs at the table were stained with red something) and it felt a little sketch.  Additionally, the overhead light had a sensor switch and literally EVERY TIME I moved it went off and the whole room lit up.  ALL. NIGHT. LONG.  Was not an enjoyable evening.

If you’re a senior and blessed to be in your advanced years the bathrooms do not favor older adults needs. If you’re looking for peace and quiet, we didn’t experience it on most of our stay. My reason for being there was to have a medical procedure at Hoag Memorial Hospital.

For the price, the service wasn’t friendly the room was okay and the outside looked like a run down motel. Breakfast was alright had to eat inside small room couldn’t take food to the room. I didn’t expect 5 stars but I did expect it to look like the website pictures which it did not

I was very impressed by the cleanliness, the comfort of the bed, the helpful staff and the reasonable price!! As a solo female traveler to a local concert, I felt very safe using Lyft to and fro and had good interactions with fellow guests!!

Quick weekend getaway trip. I took my parents and my daughter to California for a quick weekend get away and booked a room at Travelodge Costa Mesa Newport Beach Hacienda. This was the cheapest hotel I could find at the time that was close to the area that I wanted to be in. And by cheap, I mean $175.00 because it was a short notice trip. I chose this hotel because thinking that because it was branded by wyndham, it would be a pretty decent hotel. Let me tell you that was not the case. It was a major rip off. When I arrived to check in, the attendant was less than welcoming. When we went into our room and it looked clean, but smelled of smoke. I took off my shoes and the floor was sticky, slimy and gross. On top of this, when I went to take a shower, I couldn't get the water

On 7/15….I walked into a nightmare and the WORST customer service experience I have ever had to deal with. I booked my hotel stay at Travelodge through an OTA. I check in at 915pm after a day of golf at Pelican Hill for work.   The front desk staffer does not greet me or even acknowledge me he is only yelling foul langauge at his computer. I sit still at the front desk, understanding his frustration, I start checking my email as he tries to troubleshoot...I literally went through about 50-60 emails a good 20-30 minutes wait without be acknowledged once and hearing foul langauge.   Finally he addresses me and tells me "I am going to have to stay somewhere else" because he cannot check me in because his computer is down. I said here is my confirmation, the room is already paid

Room was dirty, floors were filthy, I used one of their towels to mop the floor just so I could walk to the bathroom. Would not take a bath because tub was grungy and dirty. Walls were filthy and with about 20 minutes and a magic eraser could have taken care of that problem but I guess they don’t pay attention to detail! There were a group of transient looking people smoking by the pool, not good for business! Phone didn’t work either. I would not stay here again

We were pleasantly surprised by the updated rooms.  When we arrived we were expecting to find a little bit older hotel, as that is how it looks from the outside.  However, we were pleased with the updated rooms. The room was spacious, we had a king room that had enough space for a loveseat and coffee table, with plenty of space of left open. The room was neat and clean.  Breakfast in the morning was typical for this price point.  Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Drove from San Diego to Costa Mesa the day before taking the Catalina Flyer(out of Newport) to Catalina as we didn't want to deal with the traffic, etc the next morning.   We wanted an inexpensive room just for the night.   Our room was very clean and very comfortable and close to the pool and Jacuzzi.   Was very surprised at the variety of food that was offered (free) in the breakfast room which was spotless ( thanks to Roderick always wiping down the tables, etc.)   I will definitely stay here the next time I will be in the area !!!!!!

The only good thing I can say is the bed was comfortable and the inside of the fridge was clean! The rest of the room was dirty and it had an odor so much that I went an bought a spray air freshener just so it wasn't so bad! When we got back from our night out we had to park elsewhere because there was no parking left at the hotel. I had to wear socks to walk around and the bottoms of them were black from walking across the floors. The black handprints around the door was ridiculous all it would have taken is a cleaner and a little elbow grease to remove it! I will not stay at this hotel again!

I stayed here many years ago and it was a lot nicer back then.  It is a bit run down and looks like there are residents living here now. However, there was a large TV, good selection of channels and the mattress and pillows were perfect and we got a very good night's sleep. Breakfast was really basic, powdered creamer, etc..but we couldn't complain.  Coffee was hot and bagels were large and that's all we needed.

The Travel Lodge in Costa Mesa is a good hotel. The roome are always clean and the staff is always helpful. I've stayed at this hotel several times and it's always good. I have tried others in the area and was very disappointed with each one.

Summary Heading: Not a good property for long stays only good for one night stays this property has a lot of weekly people staying at it
Summary: Not a good property for family not very clean and the floor was sticky and there was food on the floor

The girl who checked us in, Evelyn was especially friendly and professional! One of the best employees we have encountered in our 12 stays there. The bed was really uncomfortable and loud and the grate over shower was rusty and disgusting. The maid service was really good and everything was clean, if not in good condition.
We found clean comfortable room with everything we needed... except didn't have cable channel we needed to watch March Madness! Very annoying

This Travelodge is always clean, the beds are comfortable with lots of pillows and blankets, the coffee in the room is actually good. Check-in is easy at all hours, staff is very pleasant. They have a nice lite breakfast.  The location is close to everything.

Mostly stayed here due to the location and how close it was to the beach. Breakfast was included but was horrible.. They offered toast that was toasted on 1 side, cereal, apple/orange juice that was 80% watered down. Other than the food we only used the place to sleep so it served its purpose.
Good luck trying to get a room that’s actually ready. Then nobody there to help you. I was on the street for one hour past midnight. Disgrace to the hospitality industry

Summary Heading: Unusual Check In Requirement  Regarding ID
Summary: The hotel was fine.  Good: They had laminated floors instead of carpet, and the décor was nice.  Guestroom looked newly remodeled. The hotel is close to lots of shopping and a movie theater. Bad:  I was put in a room with a connecting door to a room with some college aged kids who played loud music and talked loud for a few hours so that sucked.  At check-in I think the guy may have been new because he wasn't very familiar with dealing with reservations made by third-party sites like Travelocity.  But these weren't my biggest problem.  My biggest problem I had was at check in they made a photo copy of my driver's license and credit card and kept them in a small steel box on the counter.  I don't mind them checking my ID to my credit card, but I don't like them storing my private

Travelodge overcharged our bank account for one extra day.  We have the receipt at the time of check out for $185.02 but our bank account was charged for $277.  We have been fighting this through our bank and our booking agency, as well as emailing the Costa Mesa Travelodge.

Peeling wallpaper, a  broken AC unit, rundown and tired looking outside, and a run down area that makes you fear for going out alone a Wyndam property does not make. I will say the area is improving, but only certain parts and that is obviously not the motels fault, but it still doesnt feel safe as a result. That will improve as the area drives out the riff raff. As a plus, the TV is like a 75 inch, but the good of that is greatly lessened by the fact it is HD not 4K, and I dont understand Korean. Granted I did have 3 american stations but wouldnt you know it? There was nothing on that limited selection. Same tired story with TV. The guy that checked us in was friendly and even showed us a room to view when  mentioned we read many bad reviews. There was another guy that helped

I stayed here with a friend because we were at a concert and it was too late and expensive to return to LA. Honestly this place isn’t that bad. It was cheap and it had the necessary things. Most importantly it was clean and it had free breakfast which was alright. Beds were not so comfortable though but the room is spacious. I only stayed here for one night. A plus, it is not far from Disneyland. Also, I booked the room literally 4 hours before i got there so that was good.

The room was acceptable for the price. The bad part was checking in. Someone on site had somehow cancelled my reservation. I tried to show the clerk my reservation on my phone and he just didn't care. He just kept saying "I don't have it on my computer." After 10 minutes of arguing that I did have a reservation he finally found it under cancelled reservations. He never once apologized and was just rude. Then the computer had a bad expiration date on my credit card. He couldn't fix that either. I know computers aren't perfect and mistakes happen, however being rude and unprofessional does not help the situation. Won't stay here again.
I've been staying at this hotel for years.  It's nice to see remodeled rooms.  Good value for the area.

Arrived this past Saturday (11/2/17) for a one night stay. At registration, a homeless person was checking. When my turn arose, I asked for my room not to be next to the homeless person. Staff mentioned he was allocated a room towards the back, and that he would be having another homeless person staying with him and "wasn't it nice they help each other"? After registering, we approached our room and noticed how run down the overall hotel appeared and how open the guest parking area was to the street. While our room (#130) looked decent, it had a stale smell, inexpensive look, and there was no way we could open the curtain or window open, because people keep walking by looking in and smoking. Because we were traveling, and had many items in our car that would not be in a secured

Summary Heading: Horrible I Want My Money Back
Summary: When i got to my room i noticed how old and deplorable everything was. The couch was dirty and had no fluff to it. The lights above bed were rusty. The toilet ran all night. There was a birth hole in the rug from a cigarette in a non smoking room. There was only regular tv no cable. And a small roach on my bed.

If you read a lot of the online reviews, you would think this place is a toxic place waste dump, however my experience was much, much better than that.  No mold (which is a rarity these days in hotels), clean enough, comfortable bed.  Sure it was no frills and basic, but for the price it was a great value and I would not hesitate to stay here again
The hotel has a good location.  The services were lacking. The breakfast room was small and Stark.  The food selection was anemic.

This place was convenient but poorly maintained. There was evidence that the room had recently  broken into. Repairs to door frame hadn't even been painted yet. The deadbolts between adjoining rooms were unlocked. There was a door knob literally hanging off the door. I was concerned about my safety and privacy the whole time.  The drain in the bath tub had not been cleaned out. There was a piece of soap from previous occupant in it.There were several suspicious holes (like drill holes) in the bath wall. I filled them in with chunks of soap that was provided. The staff was very friendly and helpful though. The desk clerk was shocked when I showed her the damage and problems with this room. Considering there were several motels close by for $20.00 less a night - I thought this one
Had a wonderful stay the pool and breakfast was on point and so close to the beach and a bunch of other fun things to do!!!

people upstairs were running bath/shower from 11pm-1am then our bathroom became a waterfall, leaking through light fixture, creating small lake around our bathroom. finally got some sleep. Talked to office early morning, they didn't apologize or say they were sorry just asked if I wanted a receipt

The Travelodge in Costa Mesa  is a nice place. In fact I have booked another room there for next month. The rooms are nice and there's plenty of space, plus a small fridge and microwave. Very clean. I was there during the week, so it was nice and quiet. Good cable TV package with something for everyone.
Good location, room was big and it has a lot of extras. Great swimming pool & jacuzzi & breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel.  We look forward to having the opportunity to be of service to you again in the future.  Have a great day!

Summary Heading: We stayed for one night. The guy at the front desk was very...
Summary: We stayed for one night. The guy at the front desk was very pleasant. Room was great for the price.

Summary Heading: Very good for the value. Next door woman seemed psychotic and was screaming and crying. Hotel clerk solved problem quick
Summary: Very good for the value. Next door woman seemed psychotic and was screaming and crying. Hotel clerk solved problem quick
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  And thanks for staying with us.  We hope to be able to serve  your accommodation needs again in the future.  Have a great day!

Summary Heading: The Travelodge was a nice place.  It was clean and had a...
Summary: The Travelodge was a nice place.  It was clean and had a nice continental breakfast.   Staff was ok definitely could of been more personable and friendlier. The room was clean only has old furniture definitely not upgraded could be why the price was great.

Summary Heading: Place is a dump! Oh and lets not even talk about the crime...
Summary: Place is a dump! Oh and lets not even talk about the crime scene investigation happening all morning in the room across from us. What a ripoff!

Why did we book there :  -nice location close to shopping areas (South Coast Plaza, Tustin's Market Place, The District) restaurants -great pictures of the motel on their site, attractive rooms ( the oh so called suites) -decent rates - complementary continental breakfast -free of charge parking, wi-fi  In one word : HEAVEN  What did we get :  - location : everything (shopping, good) still around PLUS the roaring 55 Freeway running through our room, NO sound proofing at all, and when finally you fall asleep, the antique air con makes sure you wake up again - Hotel, room : dirty, unkept, decaying, old, scary, could be used in a horror movie, the pictures are a big LIE, dishonest -rates: I said "decent", not they are not, you are just being ripped off! - complimentary breakfast :

Great water pressure in shower and clean towels. Housekeeping was fantastic.Room had a very comfy and cozy feel to it. Was a quiet stay. Lights had censors and timers. No elevator. Location was pretty good, there were many local fast food options for a quick bite.

Travelodge offers nice rooms at a good price range. Everything you need is present. Great breakfast and even a hot tub next to the pool. Only problem I had was with the shower. It was pretty difficult to get the right temperature and keeping it there. Kept going from hot to cold and back.

The floors were dirty and we left our socks on rather than walk on them. There were stains on the bedsheets. Our room faced a very loud and busy street so we had to play music to drown out the noise. The breakfast was minimal, bagels, muffins, boiled eggs, cereal, and some fruit like apples and bananas. When we were at breakfast a homeless woman was found digging through the trash and trying to use the washers and dryers the housekeepers use and was thrown off of the property. Overall the building could use some maintenance.  The plus side is that it was very close to both Newport and Huntington beach, and the staff
Our stay was okay.   The decor (sofa, dinette, and carpet) in desperate need of an update.  Otherwise, nice room.

Summary Heading: My 2 big problems with this stay. The toilet ran all night...
Summary: My 2 big problems with this stay. The toilet ran all night in the bathroom, and would have preferred a room not right in front of the pool very noisy. Could not sleep after long drive.

Judging from the reviews, they must be renovating some of the rooms. Unfortunately, not  the room we stayed in. The bed was clean & OK, good water pressure in the shower, small fridge, microwave, & coffee maker. But this is the first time in my life that I would not walk barefoot on the carpet...!  It was dirty, stained, and sticky...! Yuck!  I wore flip-flops in the room. And the sofa, chair, and desk chair looked lumpy & not so clean - we only sat on the bed.   The hotel is close to a lot of good restaurants, shopping, etc. If the owners would just remodel the rooms, it would be fine,  and they could charge more for the rooms. Until they fix that carpet - forget it.

The motel is in a good location if you want to spend time in Newport Beach. But it's not a good location if you want to spend any time in your room. We stayed there two nights due to my wife's outpatient treatment in a nearby hospital. The carpet was filthy -- she wouldn't walk on it with her bare feet. The toilet was running incessantly, The faucets leaked around the base when turned on. I flopped down on the couch and almost hurt myself on the wood frame that swallowed up the cushions. Normally, we would've walked out, but my wife was in no condition to wait around while we found another place. Beside the fact that the motel wouldn't give a refund on the 2 pre-paid nights. Don't let the 3.5 star review throw you off like it did us. The room was barely worth 1 star.

TV was new and accepted an HDMI cable. Mini fridge was helpful. Clean and the hot tub was nice and hot. We could smoke on site, which was nice. The bed was terrible, including the pillows - clean just not comfortable. Overall good value for the price. Don't expect much for breakfast. Old cereal, fresh coffee.

We've stayed at the Days Inn across the freeway one time and that place does not compare to the Travel Lodge.  The Days Inn costs more and the room was utterly disgusting. Stayed here for 1 night, very cozy room with a great staff. Had to call down to the office for wifi login directions and 5 minutes later the receptionist comes by my room to make sure we were able to login. Breakfast was nothing special. Fruit, hard boiled eggs, English muffins, bagels, muffins, Quaker Oats, cereal, juice and coffee, more than enough to get you going
The room was adequate but facing the street and loud. The water pressure was non existent but plenty of hot water to be had. Not a bad place but left some things to be desired for sure.

Stayed on 2nd floor away from pool area.Room was clean, linen and towels ok. A little outdated but got the job done. Breakfast was "Ok" and free! Enjoyed the 40+" Flat screen. Reserved through Wyndham Rewards , No hidden deposits here! I will be back!

I stay at this location frequently as an alternative to the other Travelodge near the airport which has the worst customer service and cleanliness. Although the staff at Hacienda Travelodge are wwonderful, accommodating and helpful, I still think this property is too pricey. The rooms are large and have mini fridge, microwave and hair dryer. No iron though! Furnishings are very dated. I prefer fluffy bed coverings but at least they are clean and white. Towels too. I recommend this hotel mainly for the great staff.

My 1st floor room had a leak in the ceiling that turned into a steady pouring of water. The front desk told me I needed to move rooms and that my belongings would be moved to the new room. After I returned from San Diego that night, I picked up my new room key. All items from the dresser were not moved. I went back to the front desk where I was informed I could not retrieve my items as the leaking room has been booked! The next morning the young lady at the front desk asked housekeeping if anything had been left in the old room. I had to ask her to call the new guests and have them look in the dresser. Guess what? My items, that were needed the night before, were there. I did not get a full night's sleep as a result. Nightmare.

During the middle of the night water was heavily flowing out of the ceiling in our bathroom. Through the light fixtures, and getting everywhere. The staff did not move the guest above us but said that the water would stop once they were done showering. Major safety issue.
The Breakfast area was way too small and lacking in tables and chairs for the large number of guests registered at the Hotel during the 2 days that we stayed there.

Easy access, parking close to rooms. Very clean, comfortable. I will be booking reservations for this hotel in the future and I would highly recommend this hotel when staying in Costa Mesa, California, to my family and friends.

The motel was close to  Newport but that was the only good thing about it.  I could hear the tv in the next room & people outside at the pool at all times.  I had to turn on the loud fan to drown out the noise.  The continental breakfast was decent though.  We did our best to just sleep & shower at this hotel.

Travelodge Costa Mesa / Newport Beach is a great place to stay and not empty your wallet. The rooms are rather spacious and all have refrigerator and microwave. The furniture is dated but the beds are new and comfortable. The bedding is fairly new and very nice (MINUS the tired, dirty, raggety bedspread found in most 2 1/2 star hotels.) The free breakfast includes instant hot cereal, cold cereal, hard boiled eggs, a variety of muffins and bagels as well as oranges, bananas and the usual milk, coffee, and teabags. Definitely no frills. The location is dead center between Costa Mesa and Newport Beach with the Hub of Costa Mesa one block away. Plenty of shopping, sightseeing, and places to play and eat. The employees are kind and friendly. Really a great staff doing a good job.

Bring your own conditioner, they do not provide any. Also, my tv remote was broken and the batteries were glued in because there was no back to the remote ? The carpets and couch were filthy with stains and crumbs. Should I go on ?

We changed rooms and the room we got smelled like cat piss. So we changed again and luckily, the 3rd room was ok. It was too late to leave for the night. Happy new year!
Ok to stay when you have no other option. Rooms are very outdated. Carpet, bed sheets are Dirty

The hotel is in a good location, the staff were nice, the room is so battered and old/dirty; we almost left.  The hotel room door barely locked and when your neighbor had to shut their doors to close them securely, we would be jolted by the loud sound.
Electrical outlets in the room are a Fire Hazard !!! Sparks fly when I tried to use the outlets. TV channels were tired.

My stay was pretty good, a few negatives about this place is poor channel selection on a 50 inch tv, furniture in room is dated, room had a slight stale smell. Positive things about this place is friendly check in staff and check out staff, security cameras, and lots of food choices close by.

Very dirty. old broke down furniture, mold on walls, no cable TV. Would not stay again even if it was for free.

Hotel is located near restaurants and stores. Very close to Newport Beach and Huntington Beach. In fact, this is one of the reasons why we chose this location. No traffic to the beach and we stayed on a weekend.  Our room was clean and had a microwave and fridge which helps. I used the computer and printer to print out amusement park tickets and the front desk staff is very accommodating. Only downside is the parking gets full.  I will stay at this place again.

Summary Heading: Excellent service at otherwise unsatisfactory hotel
Summary: The people at the front desk were great!  The hotel is in a bad area of town.  It is dark and dingy.  Definitely only a hotel to stay out when going in and out of Oakland Airport or attending a game nearby.

Good for basic necessities. Stayed 1 night. Bed was a little uncomfortable, but manageable. Clean & roomy. Had minii fridge, microwave, safe, hair dryer. Breakfast had hard boiled eggs, cereal, bagels, fruit, etc. Not fancy, but decent for a "breakfast snack" to get you through. Great location for spending time in Costa Mesa or Newport Beach.  A little difficult to get in the property, it's on sort of a one way part of the street, next to the 55 freeway.   Overall I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Even though it's cheap don't book it
Summary: The service was very kind but the hotel is so run down it should be torn down. The door to my room wouldn't even open and close correctly. I was scared for my safety. The paint in the room was pealing. The parking lot is tiny. The carpet in my room was filthy. I washed my feet in the bathroom because I'd been at the beach. They were clean when I left the bathroom but were black when I got to the bed. I will never go back to that hotel.
Had a great time, met some great people and enjoyed the pool.  It was clean and quiet with friendly staff.
This was my 3rd or 4th stay at this motel, and we keep coming back because for the price I can't find any better! Thanks

There was also a "gangster party" next door on the balcony until about 3am. I know this because they were blasting their music and taking bong rips on the balcony. NEVER EVER GOD FORBIDS WILL STAY AT THIS TRAVELODGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This motel was booked in a pinch, but the stay was comfortable. The room is good size, has refrigerator & microwave & coffee maker. Room was clean, but Carpet is very old. The motel has Pool & Jacuzzi but it closes at 10 pm. The location is great, short drive from the beach & plenty of food nearby. I would book this in advance next time to avoid overpaying. Hated the noisy Airconditioner.
It was a really good size room and perfect for what we needed it for. The price was a little on the high side, but it was in a good location.

staff was very nice! I have stayed at many travelodges and could not believe how beat up, dirty this was. Toilet rocked when you sat down, wall paint old and dirty, dirt makes on edging of front door, floor corners were black, furniture so old and beat up, the carpet ~ My husband and myself had to keep our shoes on as when I had first took mine off my feet turned black. Would have left and ask for a refund the day I checked in but had no time to find another hotel/motel  Very sad that a place that is part of Wyndham looks like this.  Will not go back.

Very run down.  The beds were comfortable but the furniture was terribly beaten up.  Carpet was badly stained and didn't feel clean.  Shower had mold in the corners and there was a stain around the base of the toilet.  My friend woke up one morning with a cockroach on her pillow.  Hair dryer didn't work.  Hotel pictures deceiving.  Suggest you ask if they have updated before booking.  Parking was also challenging.  We were advised to park at the motel next door if the lot was full.  Continental breakfast was very nice and staff were friendly.
The staff was friendly. No problems at check in. This building is old and heavily worn. Nice people, but I would not stay here again. A disappointment.
I was emailed a rate, when i checked in it was higher rate. Room smelled like cigars.i requested non smoking. Hot water in shower was inconsistent while showering.

This hotel is very close to the fairgrounds, 2 miles from the pier at Newport Beach.  It was dilapidated, the furniture had the paint coming off them, the sink was damaged and the toilet kept running and you had to jiggle the handle.   I would not stay there again.

The room was muggy & the bathroom light didn't have a cover so you could see the wires, etc. our key to the room wouldn't work so we had to get another room & it sounded like we were sleeping on the freeway. There were shady looking people sitting out in front of our room smoking.  People in neighboring rooms we're talking so loud and breakfast food was stale.
I found the service and the room to be more than satisfactory. I would recommend Travelodge to everyone in the future.
It was fine except for some noise from a guy who shut door too loud and too often. It was my first vacation in 25 yrs.

Summary Heading: Don't Judge a Book by Its Cover
Summary: This place doesn't look good from the outside.  However... the room was squeaky clean and the bed was one of the best I've slept on in years.
This is an average hotel in an expensive location. It served our purposes in being near Hoag Hospital.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Our goal is to continue to improve our property and services so we can better serve valued guests like you.

Summary Heading: This hotel should be ashamed to be open for business.
Summary: Absolutely horrible. Dirty, smells like an ashtray although it says no smoking allowed. Needs complete renovation. And we stayed in the "suite". I can't imagine what the other rooms must have looked like. Straight ghetto. The only reason we didn't leave was because it was so late and we could not find occupancy anywhere else close by. They should have paid US to stay there.

Summary Heading: Not the greatest and I love travelodge
Summary: Room was not ready. The room we got the toilet was not working. I accidentally book the wrong dates. Ask to see if I can cancel it and they said no refund, even tho I wanted Saturday-Sunday I accenditanlly did Friday-Saturday. I booked in the same hotel and they didn't even care!!

This hotel was old and rundown. Certainly not up to Wyndham standards. It smelled musty and was noisy. The price was too much for the lack of quality. I stayed two of an intended 6 nights and moved to a Radisson for less price and an excellent venue.

The motel was clean and comfortable.  However; upon check out I noticed a $30 "pet" charge on my account.  The desk clerk said that we had a cat in our room.  WE DID NOT HAVE A CAT!  He looked at a notebook at a handwritten note and said that we had a cat in the room and that they talked to us.  NO ONE SPOKE TO US ABOUT ANYTHING!  He could not take the charge off of my credit card.  I asked to speak the the manager and was told he was not available.  I left my phone and name and asked be be called.  No call and I called 2 other times with no luck.  We were charged $30 for something we did not do.

The staff was very unprofessional and not helpful whatsoever. Not once in a 5 day stay were we asked how our stay was, if we needed directions, not even a hello. Each night shady looking people were hanging out in the small parking lot which came off as them waiting on their drug dealer. Someone would pull up for 2 min, drop something off to the hotel guest in the lot, and take off. Breakfast consisted of bananas and oranges that were the same unused ones from our first day to the last as the fruit blackened by day 5. I wouldn't stay here again even if I was paid to.

Summary Heading: The only decent part of this place was the pool and spa...
Summary: The only decent part of this place was the pool and spa.  Heater. air didn't work, it was pricey, pretty mediocre...

This hotel was great. A little run down but that's ok. The people at the front desk where very friendly when we checked in and out. Our tv wasn't working in our room and the gentleman at the front desk changed our room really quick. I asked for a late check out and the lady was happy to do it. Overall great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are constantly making improvements to our hotel to better serve guests like you and hope to serve you again in the future.  Thank you for staying with us!

Summary Heading: you could here next room snoring. breakfast there was a...
Summary: you could here next room snoring.  breakfast there was a person who didn't stay there getting a free breakfast., he was very dirty looking

Summary Heading: Worth the price if you just want basics
Summary: I paid on Expedia in advance. The room was clean and neat. The maid service was very good. The free breakfast was basic. Cereal coffee toasts juices bananas   No yogurt nor waffles. Just basic but fresh. No room service but close to everything. Worth the price.
Manager Response: We appreciate your review and thank you for staying with us.  We hope to be of service to you again in the future!

Summary: Noticed some upgrades, room was clean, but a/c did not function properly; but I had to fix it due to a/c was dismantle in a couple of pieces.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We continue to strive to improve the quality of our hotel and hope to serve you again in the future!

Summary: Hotel is close to beach. Hot top and pool are a plus. Rooms are clean. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.
Rooms were a little dated and the furniture kind of beat-up, Needs more lighting as it was very dark with the curtains closed for privacy, but it was clean and served its purpose

First time I stayed overnight was when my son was attending college at UCI. I rated my stay 5 in 2002. I gave it terrible this last visit, 3/5/16 because of the following: I was given a room way in the back, level one, hallway not well lit, noticed two guys standing and talking between two parked cars at the corner end of the parking, more guys arrived. I didn't feel safe, just observed and went to the reception desk and requested a room close to the office. The room smelled smoke, although it says on the door nonsmoking. There was a tissue on the wall by the hair dryer to cover a hole. In the bathroom, the exhaust fan is without cover exposing electrical wires. In the shower, water turned cold and hot intermittently. I feel the rate I paid including tax ($102.00) for one night

On arrival, rude reception at an old hotel which is very run down. Rooms stink of the powder they put in the carpets to clean them. Hand rails and building structure crumbling in places. No elevator - so heavy bags + steps = hard work. Breakfast room tiny and selection limited. Very expensive for what it is. Would never stay there again

Summary Heading: Did not sleep at all!!! Breakfast was the best thing the had going here!
Summary: Did not sleep at all, pillows were like having nothing there, bring your own, the tv remote didn't work had to get it programmed, when we woke up in the morning there was ants all over the sink it was nasty. The bed blankets had stains on them. The kid at the office was very nice, and attentive. :) . Location was not too far from the beach, but in order to get to the hotel you have to come way before it and pull up to it from the streets, because its right out of the 55 turning into Newport BLVD. So you have to use the streets to get to it. Oh and there's 150 channels with nothing on them. Not worth $130 dollars your better of staying at motel 6 and getting breakfast at Dennis. Breakfast was the best thing going for this Hotel.

I booked this never having been to Costa Mesa.  Upon my arrival I was put in a room very close to the highway.  The pictures DO NOT REFLECT THE AREA!  I asked for something farther away from the road but they were booked.  Upon entering the room, you could tell it was extremely old.  One light fixture by the bed did not work at all.  The overall feel was dirty. I left the next day for some site seeing.  Upon my return, the trash can was completely covered in ants.  It was late, so I cleaned it up myself.  I will never stay there again!!
It's quite ok. Parking a bit weird. Close to airport, clean. Night attendant new and untrained.

I travel often, and this was hands down the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in.  The room was musty, broken and dirty.  I checked in just long enough to drop my bags in my room and leave for the night.  When I arrived at 3 a.m, to sleep, exhausted from travels and the nights events, I arrived to spilled beer and empty cans loitering the path to my door, people partying in two of the rooms on either side of me, the knobs on the ac unit were broken, and I spent 10 minutes trying to get them on just enough to turn on the unit, which smelled.  The bathroom floor was dirty, there were old blood marks on the white sheets of BOTH beds, and the shower head barely put out a drizzle and the water was cold for my shower in the morning.  Upon checking out, I asked for either a full refund or

The room is dirty, the carpet on the floor is extremaly dirty. Will not use this hotel again. We could not get a baby crib, even they said they had. Air condition very noisy. The biggest problem - rooms are extremaly dirty.

Summary Heading: All in all was great! TV reception was poor.Noise from...
Summary: All in all was great! TV reception was poor. Noise from quest was loud but I quess what can you expect.

water constantly ran in shower, couldnt shut off, carpet filthy and heater made very load noise, sounded like a semi truck idling in the room with you.  Nothing special to attrack customer to this hotel other than being in its location.  If it was located anywhere else it would be a complete dive.  I would also have to reset my room keys daily as when i got back to the room after working all day the key wouldnt work, very frustrating.  TV in bad location as well.  The safe in the room didnt work at all, which with the poeple staying around there is a bad thing, some shady tenants around this hotel.  Wont stay at this one again, just a below average hotel, nothing special.
Hotel was good but to many people kept knocking on the door and calling no stop for a different person. Didn't like being woke up 4 different times

In a bad neighborhood Garbage and cigarette butts litter the property Inside my room maintenance was horrible. The bathroom door lock was broken and they stuck tissue in the cylinder hole to prevent the door from closing and locking someone in.  There were stains on the bathroom wall. There were cigarette burns in the bed blanket in a non-smoking room
A nice property the room was wonderful and the people and stuff for great we had a wonderful stay at the travel lodge Hacienda in Costa Mesa off of Newport Boulevard keep up the good work

Summary Heading: The manager and clerk, it was like  the blind leading the...
Summary: The manager and clerk, it was like  the blind leading the blind. Over charged me and the clerk said the manager would call me to clear up the situation. Never a phone call. They were giving me the run around of when the Manager would be back in..No show for the 2 days I stayed their. Very shady

Summary Heading: Nice last minute stay in OC
Summary: Make reservations easy. Not by the beach,,, Large room very quite and slept well over night  all the rooms are non smoking but will make sure you are able to step out comfortable, Jacuzzi did work just very small but good for a quick splash

This room needs repair: front door VERY difficult to open and close and almost impossible to lock; bathroom door difficult to close; wallpaper peeling in bathroom; very noisy from the outside; needed an extra blanket.
Nice hotel location.  For sure, I can say the best location. Close to the heart of Costa Mesa, restaurants, freeway, South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island.

Summary Heading: Room was clean and tidy, but the screen kept falling out of...
Summary: Room was clean and tidy, but the screen kept falling out of my window, a homeless man got in a very loud argument with a staff member in the parking lot one morning, and someone grazed the front end of my car (slight scuff mark and license plate frame broke off...didn't notice until i arrived home).

I travel a lot, and use multiple hotels.   I felt like the front desk was not very helpful, the cleanliness of the wrist hotel was terrible, but when I mentioned it the next morning show any concern I really would appreciate a phone call regarding this visit. 949-289-1033
The hotel was dirty and transients where on property. We could not take our little ones to the pool. The carpets where so dirty our feet where blackened .

disgusting smelly unsafe dirty a/c didn't work. Door had to be kicked to close. Bathroom light didn't work and was terribly loud as if the fan was attempting to work. Dirty socks were left on floor. Room smelt like urine. Street people were loitering. Felt unsafe. Toilet barely flush. Had to get a diff room with functioning lights and A/c. Will never stay there.

Summary Heading: On the 8th, the continental breakfast was nearly empty. No...
Summary: On the 8th, the continental breakfast was nearly empty. No coffee, one orange and some bagels.  Also, the AC needs updating. Very noisey.

I don't know how they get away with using Newport Beach in the name, they are nowhere near, not that Costa Mesa isn't a nice City but they managed to find a seedy spot. The place is very insecure, people coming in and out at all hours, there is no security or impediments to just walking in off the street, I definitely saw some shady characters, I had a few bags in my car and had no intention of bringing them in, I quickly changed my mind about that. I think if you do a little research you should be able to find something better for the same amount or even less.

This place has nothing to do,with Newport Beach so they really have no business using the city in their name. The city of Costa Mesa is quite nice in and of itself but they somehow managed to find the one spot in the city that is kind of seedy. The rooms are dated and dirty,mothers is a funky smell in the air. There were some shady looking characters walking around the hotel, not sure if they were guest or just wandered in off the street, there is no security and access is quite easy, the hotel is right against the street. I was afraid to leave anything in my car,mimwasmafraid to leave my car, aside from the characters wandering around the parking lot is quite tight and people are coming in and out all night. For the money you can do a lot better

Our stay here was very nice, the property was clean and in good order, the pool was sparkling, the service was excellent. The continental breakfast was very welcoming, especially the coffee. It's close to restaurants and Bev Mo and CVS which was a plus for us. I'd highly recommend staying here. I would stay here again.

Management was not very helpful. The internet was not working after I asked for the username and password. When I told them it still did not work, they seemed to not care. I felt like I was a burden. The remote control in the room did not work. I received another remote and that one did not work either. The room itself was pretty good.

Summary Heading: I'm relocating and starting a new job and live out of the...
Summary: I'm relocating and starting a new job and live out of the area so I stayed the week. $$ was why I stayed here and also had mini fridge & microwave in room which made it just what I needed. Location not so great so I stayed in my room...

The carpet was so dirty it would blacken your socks.  The breakfast room was filthy and 2 employees along with the front desk clerk walked through and left it dirty.  The non-smoking room smelled of smoke and there were no other rooms available.  So for what you are paying, find somewhere else to stay.  The management just does not seem to care about the condition of the Travelodge.
we enjoyed our stay at the Travel Lodge. friendly staff. it was convenient where the hotel was. by great restaurants, stores and especially the beach.
We stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night and found it to be clean and very quiet.  The staf was excellent and knowledgeable about things to do in the area. I would definitely stay again.

The rooms were clean, but the furnishing was run down. The chairs were broken, the TV remote did not have charged batteries. I reserved two rooms that were nonsmoking, and one room smelled of smoke so bad my guess could not stay in the room.
Not like the photos on the website. The floor made our feet dirty, the TV remote didn't work and the furniture was dirty and full of smudges and fingerprints. The front desk people were kind though.
Nothing great about the place but nothing bad to say either.  Only stayed one night and worked fine for a "bed to sleep in" didn't' spend any time on the property except to sleep.

The walls are thin. You can hear if someone is just walking down the hall. Carpet was dirty and the room was stuffy and in need of a bit of updating. Free wireless was very slow. The cable channels listed in the room did not match with what was on the TV.

Our stay was pretty good. I liked that the girl who checked us in was nice and friendly. The room was dated but bed was comfortable. I also liked that it had highend shampoo and conditioner. The pool and hot tub were awesome!! It was very nice that it stayed open late! My only complaint was that im the morning the lady in the continental breakfast area was very rude! Wouldn't let my little girl eat cereal because we got there right at 9:30. If you ask me 9:30 is not a standard time hotel breakfast should end. I travil a lot and everyone I have ever been at ended at 10:00. The lady was not nice at all and rolled her eyes at me. I would have rated my stay a 4 if not for her bad service and attitude

Summary Heading: I stay here quite often when visiting my Son. Have had both...
Summary: I stay here quite often when visiting my Son. Have had both good and not so great experiences. The staff is helpful all though the facility needs upgrades. I always request a room by the poolside, for the back of the hotel can be quite noisy with some shady people.

Good location with quick access to freeway. Property sorely in need of cleaning. Air conditioner broken in room 202, carpet so dirty our feet were black every time we walked on it, no stopper in tub to take a bath, towel rack broken. Working all hours of the night on stairs outside a few feet from our room, jack hammering on highway disrupted sleep.

Summary Heading: The property was older. My front door to the room was very...
Summary: The property was older. My front door to the room was very hard to open and close. The bathroom door did not close all the way. Carpet was dirty and overall cleanliness was below my expectations for price of room.

I booked my room weeks in advance, non smoking! When I arrived they said they had 1 room left and it was smoking - NOTHING I CAN DO SAID THE FRONT DESK! said they would change my room the next day. The room was TERRIBLE-DIRTY AND OLD! The next day SURPRISE-THERE WAS NOT ANOTHER ROOM AVAIABLE! WORST HOTEL WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!

Our air stopped at 4 a.m., the next night the guy "fixed" it yet, it did the SAME thing the next night.  My husband got up to switch it back on, like the service guy had done, and it kept switching back off.  Finally, after turning it back on 3- 4 times, it would no longer even respond.  Also, the bathroom was dirty, around the floor and the soap dish in the tub.  Never stay there again.

I was visiting family and friends so didn't need a room except for sleeping and showering. Fine for those EXCEPT the carpet is filthy. Just after a shower I neded to put shoes on or wash the bottoms of my feet before bed. This is my only complaint. Staff was courteous and helpful, breakfast was as advertised. Too bad the City of Costa Mesa had to work on the freeway at night.
Our room was clean, breakfast adequate.  Staff also friendly. Laugh as you will the taller commode was the most comfortable for my aging body.  Absolutely the got a good nights rest and.

I would not even recommend it. I was check-in the room at the front and you can hear everything. Cars and people walking by. The people next door, I would clearly hear their conversation. It was also hard to close the door and I had to push it in.  The only positive was it's about 10mins from the airport and costed $10 to uber.

We were treated with total respect, the check in was easy, the front desk staff when checking in was very helpful. When we needed something such as ironing board and iron, blanket it wasn't an issue. Very pleased. We have been coming here for the past 11 years and will continue to come.
Good location, low price, short on parking when full, everything worked, good for party crowd, loud. Dirty.

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for
Summary: room smelled like old man sweat. guest two doors down sat outside door chain smoking and drinking beer with a pit bull he had in his room. hours between 2:00 and 3:30am are the worst. guests coming home from bar drunk dropping beer bottles on sidewalk outside the door. should have spent the extra $30 a night to stay at a nicer place 15 minutes away.
I have stayed at this property several times. It is clean, safe, locally owned and the employees are wonderful at Guest Services.

While the location is ideal (close to the beach, shops, restaurants), the service is not. The staff are not especially friendly and when the toilet was giving me problems and I called for assistance, the gentleman at the front desk told me he didn't have anyone to help me and I'd have to fix it myself.

Summary Heading: I usually stay at this hotel whenever I go to Newport...
Summary: I usually stay at this hotel whenever I go to Newport Beach.  It is close to dining and close to the beach.  As usual the service is good, the rooms are clean however I just hope they would add more pillows.  I have written about it on my other surveys but nothing has been done about it.  We like watching television while in bed and with the lack of sufficient support on our heads we end up getting stiff necks.

We really enjoyed out stay.  It was a quiet upper as we asked.  It fit our needs perfectly, near our friends who already had a full house.  Staff were friendly and efficient.  Breakfast was more than our appetite.  Since we are decaf  people, it would have been nice to have decaf coffee, but other places do not have it either and we had decaf in our room
room was not clean local police did a bust and I  was denied access to my room as soon as I could get in I grabbed my luggage and left I have a reservation for July that I may cancel

Blood stains on the wall. Carpet was multi colored but wasn't suppose to be. Shower fixture broken. Smelly room. Druggies outside my room the whole night. We left but they still charged Dee the full price and thus m rent check bounced! Thanks allot A ss holes

Summary Heading: I would not stay here again.
Summary: Unfortunately even though the front desk staff was adequately helpful the room was not up to expectations. - The carpet in the room turned our feet black. We quit taking our shoes off until we went to sleep. - Floor in the bathroom was not swept over two days.  We left after two of the 3 nights we were planned to stay.   The room was $100 approximately a night but I was not interested in spending the 3rd of the 3 nights here.  This property needs work.

Guys, I sincerely appreciate this oportunity. As I write to you, I´m sitting at Marriot´s Residence Inn, room 313, quietly relaxing over the past 9 days of absolute hell. I travelled from Argentina on business May 11 to attend important business. I chose your hotel from a huge selection of hotels, and being in the travel industry, I once contemplated signing up with you guys for a year long travel binge. To be specific, the first week, the hote eaw hosting an out of state Lacrosse team. Although the guys lost the national tournament, the tore the place apart by the time they left. I am a person in recovery, so I am very experienced with what I have been watching going on here.  Almost every room is buzzing with drug addicts, dealers delivering drugs here and tweakers peaking out of their curtains and only coming out long enough to greet people on bicycles i the parking lot,  I feel bad for the hotel owners, except there is absolutely no way they can't know what is going on here it is so blatant.  I hope this review helps them look at the clientele they are appealing to, because for 100 bucks a night this is a very bad deal.

This is a perfect example of why you can't trust the photos that hotels post on their websites.  It looks really nice, but it's nothing like what you see on line!  It's dirty and noisy!  The television didn't work half the time as the channels wouldn't come clear enough to watch.  They have a list of channels on the desk, but most weren't available.  I called the desk and the guy said that was an old list and said I could come down and get a current one.  There is no light on the desk so I had to do my paperwork on the bathroom counter just so I could see. The only thing good was the location was perfect for my business trip.  I already found a place up the street that I stopped into last night and they were nice enough to let me view the rooms and property.  I'll be staying
I asked for 2 additional days. They gave me 2 days instead. I thought I had paid for 3 days. They took my stuff out of the room. It was very inconvenient.

Summary Heading: Ghetto...Spend the money and stay elsewhere.

She was given her room by the staff, who were trying to get some control of the situation and went to her room.  The condition of the room was awful! It was a horrible room and my wife called me saying she refused to stay there and did not feel safe at all (and she doesn't scare easily)!  She jumped in her car and fled! Summary Heading: Save yourself by staying somewhere else
Summary: Hotel is tired and old. Carpet's dirty. Room smells bad. Dead bolt on door doesn't work. First time I ever had to prop a chair on the door handle for safety. Pay the extra money and stay somewhere else.

Summary Heading: the hotel itself that I stayed at was ok its in a great...
Summary: the hotel itself that I stayed at was ok its in a great location due to the other businesses around it the inside of the bedrooms a little outdated and old old fashioned their cable system for the TV is ridiculous. does Allah seems to be like there's transients at night roaming the property

Summary Heading: We checked in at 2:30pm in room 212 and were woken up at...
Summary: We checked in at 2:30pm in room 212 and were woken up at 12:30AM saying we were in the wrong room, they said we were suppose to be in 121. We had all our paper work, they were very rude to us. Then they called us and said we could stay,well between you and me we weren't going to move.
Door locks problematic  hard to unlock, heater falling apart, room door has big gap, room could use some renovation

Summary Heading: Dirtiest Room in five years of business travel
Summary: Drive up appearance nice, front desk and lobby nice, quick professional registration. From there downhill. Stairway dirty, second floor patio dirty, bathroom floor dirty, wiped down with towel. After shower, walked to bed, feet were BLACK, had to wash with hand towel to put on socks. Toilet dirty, bath fan broken, doors dirty. Basic wipe down with damp rag, cleaned up walls, doors, counters. Carpet hopeless. Breakfast good, morning office staff again, professional, polite,helpful.
LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!! Its on the border of Costa Mesa & Newport beach. 10 min from beach. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, shopping, thrift stores etc. Love staying here.
Personnel pleasant...no snack machines...breakfast is cereal, toast, banana, tv did not have any sports channels for casual time, rooms clean and adequate
The staff was overall very friendly was very pleased. The rooms were very nice.my stay was very satisfying

My husband and I stayed here twice. The first time our room was back behind by the pool and it was very nice. The second time our room was up front, it wasn't as nice. The rug was scary, paint was peeling and the air conditioning had a mind of its own.  I would stay here again if I had a room in the back.

I've stayed here before and most of those times it was good. This time was terrible we had a bottom floor room at the back of the property. The people above us where up all night In and out of their room. Had a gentleman knock on our door at 3:15am had way too much traffic that late at night. The bathroom looked like it had black mold in the shower.

Friday 1-30-15 stayed here around 10:20 pm someone began knocking on door than window.  My wife asked who it was, just kept knocking we opened up curtins and saw a man demanding to come in.  Scared and worried I wanted him to go away so I used strong language and gave him a gesture.  He said we would call police and left. I called down to front desk to let them know strange guy trying to get into our room.  Front desk said it was employee and we had noise complaint.  I said we were quitely watching nightly news she responded that we need to keep it down.  Okay we thought...can't get much quieter. Did not care we were scared.  Another knock came this time he said front desk.  We opened the door he had brought police to our door.  He then tried to lecture us about using the hand

I've stayed here several times  before but found my stay this trip very disappointing.  It started with the smell in the rooms they had a strong odor and the carpets patched poorly and very dirty I rented to adjoining rooms.  The tvs did not function properly only allowing viewing of two channels in both rooms.  One room with a bad shower head, loose toilet seat ect.  the continental breakfast but has changed since my last stay now very cheesy set up.  I would stay again but would inspect room before renting, close to sport fishing which is the reason I stay.

Nice place to stay,very,very clean.The breakfast was much more than I expected. Just a week before my husband and I stayed at another wyham propertyand it was not as nice AND it was more expensive. Travelodge you are are one and only now.

Summary Heading: Wifi and rooms needs to be remodeled
Summary: During check in, the receptionist was training a new hire and taking extremely long to do each step. I booked the room by phone and had my confirmation number. But it still took about 20-25 mins to get everything done. Very unacceptavle. The room I was in looked clean, but there were putty patches that weren't painted over. Very tacky and simple fix with just some paint. The wifi didn't work. Called the front desk and was told by a gentleman that the section I was in couldn't connect to wifi. If this was a known issue, why give me a room that can't connect wifi. Better yet why not just fix the problem. It's just wifi. Even lower quality motels have wifi. Not a very satisfied customer. Doubtful I will ever use this chain again.

I and my family stayed in Room 102 last Friday. It was not too pleasurable because the room was filthy. Wanted to heat water in the microwave but found that the microwave had a piece of old pizza in there. No hot water at 6AM. It was horrible. Manager was polite enough to give a discount BUT the feeling that we stayed in a dirty room made us very unhappy.

Summary Heading: a huge disappointment, will not repeat and will discourage friends and family from using
Summary: Dear travelodge,  It's nothing personal, but my recent stay there near Triangle Square in Costa Mesa, CA, was a huge disappointment.  The place is shabby by any standards, and noisy as hell.  The party next door sounded like it was IN my room.  I did not feel safe here, not worth a single penny and I will never, ever, ever, ever, etc. be coming back.  Other travelers, look out, I think this is a flophouse.

Summary Heading: Front desk / breakfast manager was very rude and commented...
