Summary: Front desk / breakfast manager was very rude and commented on my guest's eating habits in a derogatory manner.  She was also unwilling to hold our bags after checkout until our transportation arrived.

Warm welcoming staff and conveniently located but greatly in need of an overhaul. Rooms are cramped and musty smelling, bathrooms are small and overheated by powerful overhead lamps, bathroom sink and counter space are outside of the toilet and shower stall and far too close to the microwave and fridge area. Was due to stay for 10 days but moved out after one night.
My DVD player was missing from my room. The cost was 125 dollars which needs to be reimbursed.

I grew up 1 & 1/2 miles from the motel, so on my 50th Birthday I wanted to be close to were it all started. I found the Motel very clean, the staff was very helpful, and the room was comfortable. My only complaint was the carpets did show there age, but over all I will stay there again. It is located close to all fun things to do.
I was very comfortable. I especially enjoyed the large HD television and the high powered air conditioner.  Only major complaint was no hot water for shower. Very disappointed there.

I stayed at the Travel Lodge in Costa Mesa CA. On the corner of Newport Blvd. And 19th ST. I was in room 205 ( a smoking room ). The room was disgusting. I have a Shi Tzu service dog that is 13 lb. and I was afraid of HIM touching the floor. I had to put his food on the bathroom counter so that he could eat due to the fact that the carpet looked as though it soaked in human urine, Smelt like a wet ashtray. i had to go to the office 20 minutes after checking in because the toilet set wasn't even attached.  I stay in smoking rooms must of the time I have to travel. I have never seen anything close to this hell hole.  I was there to follow up with my son (age 23) because he had been in a horrifying car Accident and I went this time to get ALL the specialist he needed.  Under any
Excellent spotless room, great breakfast provided, enough to start anyone's day. Front desk was very helpful giving directions.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and quiet - just what I needed for a business trip
Summary: I stayed for 4 nights in October, and found the room to be comfortable. There was plenty of hot water shower, and the room has everything I needed. The folks at the front desk were very nice, and I would definitely stay there again!!  Just a word of caution, though - remove your valuables from your vehicle!! A fellow guest had his bike stolen out of the back of his truck overnight. We all know this happens, but it's still a bummer when it does. I don't think the area is especially high crime, but it's avoidable if you take some precautions.

Summary Heading: Probably the worst night I have spent in a motel.  The...
Summary: Probably the worst night I have spent in a motel.  The problem was some of the other guests who were parting and drunk but management could have and should have done more.  This is especially true considering that the same bunch had caused the same problems the previous night.  If not for this I would rate them average for the facilities or above average for the location.

Summary Heading: Easy Check-in, Close to all downtown beach areas.Have...
Summary: Easy Check-in, Close to all downtown beach areas. Have stayed there many times over the past 10 years. Marjorie is great....!

I don't mind an "older" or "dated" hotel, but it needs to be clean and tidy. From the peeling wall paper in the bathroom to the floors that looked like they hadn't been mopped in some time, this place needed attention! I may spend the extra hundred dollars the next time I am in LA to avoid this type of place.

Saw ants all 4 days....only cleaned room twice, no new towels......Travel Lodge tried  to change rates and up my stay by $68 on a confirmed Wyndham rewards package......TV guide from Fairfield Hotels was being used and didn't match TV cannels for this hotel

decent rooms phenomenal location ok breakfast but hey we come here for the beach not for fabulous beds and linens. Great place to crash worth the priceand some of the guests stay long periods of time are awfully fun to talk to.
Refrigerator didn't work, blow dryer was broken. Carpet was so dirty, our feet were b;lack from going barefoot in room.

I was so disappointed with this place. We booked it for two night but stayed only one night.  The place is smoking, near each room there are ashtrays full of butts. I took a picture. You open the door and get a smoke right in your face. The air conditioner is very loud. It was as if I was sleeping in the room with working vacuum cleaner. Sometimes it started to rattle. I have read in one of the reviews that the place is rather loud , but with working air-conditioner you will not hear outside noise. Yes this is true. The room does not have a window that could be opened to get fresh air ,and you need to have an air-conditioner on all the time or it becomes very hot. Overall the room is rather dark, one window is draped with heavy drapes , which you can not open because of privacy.
The manager was very accommodating for our large group. We had several rooms and family traveling on different days and they arranged us to be located together on the property. Thank you!

Summary Heading: The hotel was fine the person who checked us in was rude...
Summary: The hotel was fine the person who checked us in was rude and wouldnt honor my aaa card as your advertising said

Room was good size, bathroom was clean, fridge and microwave works fine,too. But mattress was very hard and carpet needs to be clean. I used to only sleep there, so it was reasonable enough for one night. It was ok for myself, but I will not take my child with...
Hotel room old looks likes it was painted years ago. AC did not work all the time,

Rooms needing general upkeep and maintenance. Vanity sink would not hold water. Handle on shower almost ready to fall off. Shower heads clogged with calcium. Bed hard as a rock!! Had to go buy an egg crate to be able to sleep. Maid failed to show up one day.

Summary Heading: a/c not working during hot weather
Summary: I had stayed here before approx. one year prior for the same occasion of visiting the Orange County Fair.  The room and staff were not up to par this trip.  Problems with the air conditioner were unresolved by the staff and no other room on the premises was available even after we were first told there was on two separate days.  We had packed up all our things to move and then called for the new room number and were then told no other rooms were available after the manager stated he would move us.  I found the room to need updating and cleaning.  I had stayed in this very room last year and was sorely disappointed this time around.  I will not return here.

Summary Heading: great location - ok room - management did work with me
Summary: This motel is in good location. The rooms do need an update. Our air conditioner did not work the first night and management did issue a credit. That was a good thing. Great restaurants within walking distance.

Summary Heading: DON'T STEP FOOT IN THIS HOTEL!!!
Summary: This hotel needs a major over haul!!!  The rooms are filthy.  I took my shoes off and walked around barefoot, what a mistake.  My feet were black from the filth on the carpet.  I'm glad there wasn't a fire during our stay because our smoke dectector was covered by a plastic bag.  I guess there were smokers in the room prior to us.  The people in the room next to ours, who I think were living there, spent the whole day smoking pot.  The shower had mold growing out of the ceiling and around the edges of the tube and inbetween the tiles.  The free breakfast was awful.  I've been to other hotel chains and the breakfast was good.  I wouldn't call what they had breakfast.  I have nothing good to say about this hotel.  It was a complete dive.  If I could get my money back I would.

I am not sure why I read good reviews about this property.  Our non smoking room smelled like carpet deodorizer, smoke and urine.  There was a burn mark on the toilet as well, there is no way the proper measures were made to turn this room into a non smoking room.  The bed was hard as a rock and the pillows sucked.  Yes the location was ok but that is the only good thing I will have to say about this place.  The TV barely worked and our door was very hard to shut and lock. The free breakfast was a joke and they ran out of coffee.  I should have known by the price on the weekend that this place was a dump.  If I hadn't already paid and had a prior engagement I had to be at I would have found another place to stay.  Yuck!  I would look at the Holiday Inn across the street before

Summary Heading: non smoking room but had odor and ashtray right outside the...
Summary: non smoking room but had odor and ashtray right outside the door. horrible shower pressure. questionable live in tenants.
Used Wyndham rewards poibnt ot pay for this stay.  They are slowly upgrading this motel.  Breakfast was better than last year.

Summary Heading: The good, the bad and the ugly
Summary: GREAT location...wonderful service. BUT...the carpet is filthy and was torn right in front of the bathroom. Had to FIX the toilet in the middle of the night as the chain that lifts the flapper broke and the bathroom door would NOT close...had to hold it with our feet! We will stay again...we wear flip flops whenever we stay in a motel. Cannot beat the price, the location and the wonderful staff. Hoping they address the issues with the carpet (tile is GREAT guys!) and the bathroom.
The best part of the stary was the friendly cat who greeted everyone when they headed over for breakfast. The room was clean, yet the bed and pillows were old and lumpy.

Summary Heading: Definitely a good value for the price.  Clean, quiet and...
Summary: Definitely a good value for the price.  Clean, quiet and friendly staff.  Would recommend for future travel.

It seems like the motel was under some renovations.  Our room was clean and satisfactory.  A suggestion would be that when the giant screen TVs are mounted that they go across from the bed.  Most people like to watch TV from the bed.  Also, the chairs were very uncomfortable, so we sat on the bed even more.  The pool was not at all clean when we arrived, but by the end of the week it was clean and we were able to swim in it.  The location was excellent.  We could walk to a health food store and plenty of restaurants in walking distance as well.

Summary Heading: Costa Mesa Newport Beach Hacienda Travelodge
Summary: Clean, comfortable, simple. Breakfast was decent, but nothing to get excited about. Lots of traffic noise from our room, but with the A/C on it wasn't bad. Non-smoking room smelled like smoke. No remote for TV, but the TV was a nice, large flat screen.

In short, the hotel is completely disgusting and not worth the $100/night they charged. I would have paid double for a nicer hotel if I knew that this place was in such shoddy condition. If you have another option for lodging in the Costa Mesa area, I would recommend staying anywhere but the Travel lodge. To end on a positive note, the front desk manager was helpful and nice.

This place is a gem. We feel comfortable in the room, which has comfy beds, nice place to sit with couch and coffee table, fridge, and microwave. The pool and jacuzzi are perfect. The coffee is good and breakfast buffet is the weakest point. We walked to movies and meals. Staff pleasant and laundry room works. Bring kibble as there's a cute kitty.

The hotel was outdated. Although that's not really what bothered me the most. The carpet and bedding needed to be cleaned properly. I believe there were mites or something that caused me to itch all over. It was awful. I had to make sure not to expose skin to the floor and bedding in order to avoid getting small bites on my skin. The bed was also so old, it was saggy and very uncomfortable. Eek.

Upon arrival our first room 206 smelled like urine. We were then moved to room 227 and we noticed what appeared to be mites in the corner of the shower. The mites were reddish and brown and they kept reappearing even after cleaning them off multiple times. We have pics if you would like. I was very disappointed with this hotel and I will not be staying here again. In addition I felt unsafe a few times do to the constant presence of crack heads and drugies. This place is the arm pit of newport beach. Also, I work in the hotel industry as a room service waiter so I usually don't complain and I understand how it is, but this hotel was is in need of a renovation badly.

Summary Heading: When I first arrived, the lobby was locked. There was a...
Summary: When I first arrived, the lobby was locked. There was a sign that said the clerk was taking care of a room or guest. I waited outside for about 6 minutes. The short wait didn't bother me. The clerk was very nice and apologetic and got me checked in very quickly.  I chose a non smoking room because I have Asthma. I am affected by second hand smoke greatly The room next to me (217) might have been a smoking room. Late at night the occupant(s) of that room smoked and the smoke was creeping into my room through the bathroom area where the wash basin is. This was at 3am or so and there was nothing I could really do about it. It didn't last long. My suggestion, request non smoking rooms next to non smoking rooms. One thing though the same occupant smoked right out side his door

Summary Heading: There is a reason why this hotel is so inexpensive.
Summary: The price and location were right but DISGUSTING HOTEL.  The evening lady at the front desk tried so hard to accommodate us but the Assistant Manager in the morning was rude, unaccommodating, unapologetic, etc.  I was very polite and wanted to let her know how gross the mattresses were with stains and all and she pretty much blew me off.  HORRIBLE assistant manager.

After running away from the dump that was Motel 6 in Santa Ana, I was looking for another place for the night. The Travelodge was clean, but nothing special. My room was on the first floor looking out at the pool. It was a very noisy spot. I could hear people talking loudly all night, and the noisy splashing of people at the pool. There's a small fridge and microwave in the room. If you want peace and quiet, this probably isn't the place for you. Maybe the rooms on the 2nd floors were quieter.

We have had several problems as we stare here. We live here Monday thru Friday every week our most complaints are the noise from rude people. We had a huge problem from the key service with our room this week. I could not open the room with a key and neither could the maid who I had try three times to get me in. I went through about 12 keys this last week. Very inconvenient to try to get into the room. Fix the problem I was in room 125 and I have booked a room for the next week. I don't like to complain, But fix the problems. Another issue is that the rooms coffee sucks it is watered down and most of the time the maids do not check to see if you have sweetener packages to even doctor up this coffee.

Stayed here with out son on a recent trip to SoCal for his spring break.  Convenient to OC and LA stuff we wanted to do.  Nice rooms, a pool and spa that worked, and a decent breakfast buffet bar.  I would stay again.

for the price this was a nice clean room. the staff was friendly and helpful. the breakfast was good and the bed was comfortable. the have pride in their hotel and it shows. the rooms are older but very well maintained. my new hotel when I visit Ca.
very happy with the hotel nice clean room, if I had to say anything negative it would only be about the tv channels hard to figure out, but no big deal was not there to watch tv.

I'd stayed here before. It wasn't fancy, but priced as I needed. I returned, and found the room I'd stayed in before now smelled of smoke. They let me swap rooms, but the new one was in a bit of disrepair. However, the breakfast was nice, it's very convenient, and relatively inexpensive.

When the first room was smokey, we immediately got into a smoke-free room. When I left my pillow, the staff arranged to have it mailed to my home. The breakfast was healthy. So Travelodge was everything we expected for what we needed.

We had a nice time at the Travelodge Costa Mesa Hacienda. Our room was clean and comfortable, and we enjoyed having breakfast the next morning as well. The staff was very helpful, and we appreciated having the computer in the business center to check email and websites.

Most of the rooms have opening and closing problem and they are noisy. TV remotes are very basic and do not match the TV. Hard to find parking space on week-ends. Rooms do not have matching furniture.

I booked in for three night stay in  February  2014 because of its convenient  location but I checked out after the first night even though I had paid in full! My room was spacious but overlooked the main road and because the window was badly fitted and single glazed the noise from traffic was bad even at 3am. I asked to be moved to a quieter room but was told  I couldn't.  The room itself was clean but old fashioned  the bed not too bad.  The door to the room didn't feel secure and the hallway to the room being outside was dirty. Breakfast was of limited choice.  It was not the worst place I have stayed but I was happy to leave after the first night.  I stayed the rest of my time at the Holiday Inn which  was in complete contrast.  If you book specify a room that does not
sorry I don't mean to complain, but the smell of smoke and the uncleaniness of the room was horrible

Needed a place to stay and this was it, close to Newport for our appointments. Staying again this week although the bed was a little firm. There was some people arguing but before I could call the desk, another visitor stuck his head out the door and quieted the people. Like having a room with a fridge for eye medicine or soda, and a microwave plus free breakfast that includes fruit.

I booked a stay at the Travelodge in a pinch.  I wanted somewhere cheap to stay and was hoping that this place would be fine. The location was very convenient but that's about it.  When I got to the hotel, somehow they didn't have my reservation.  After talking to Priceline customer service for a very long time, it turns out that one of the hotel staff members accidentally cancelled our reservation.  The rooms were recently renovated so the bathoom was actually pretty nice.  The couch on the other hand was pretty old and gross looking.  One of the rooms that we booked was non-smoking, but smelled very strongly of cigarettes so that was unpleasant.  The room seemed clean, but slightly decayed.  The worst part of our stay at the travelodge was the bug infestation.  During the

Front desk staff was very nice and helpful during check out. My room was better than expected, the price was great, and a great location! Everywhere I went was walking distance or a cheap taco ride. Would definitely recommend this hotel to other and will definitely stay here again.

I booked 18 nights in a first floor room with 2 queen beds from 12/12/13 to 12/30/13. Rooms are spacious with flat screen TVs, in room safes, in room microwaves and in room refrigerators. There is a pool on property, hot tub on property, laundry on property, vending on property, ice machine on property and very modest continental breakfast. The pros: cheap price, GREAT location, friendly staff, very clean, rooms have all you need. The cons: loud, old, worn, uncomfortable furniture, mismatched, damaged furniture, uncomfortable beds, continental breakfast was miserly & weak, a neighbor died 12/21/13 a few rooms away causing a ruckus. Another neighbor complained about roaches and while we had none, we did kill small spiders daily in the bathroom and a rat ran past our front door.

Summary Heading: The hotel was very clean and good sized for a room with two...
Summary: The hotel was very clean and good sized for a room with two beds. Wish the bathroom was larger though.

Summary Heading: Close to where I needed to visit.Carpet could have been...
Summary: Close to where I needed to visit.Carpet could have been cleaned a little better. Bed lamp switch needed to be adjusted to make lamp  work

Summary Heading: Front desk staff are lost and more concerned about parting after work
Summary: I can't believe that I told the front desk clerk one night and book me for two. That screw up sent me to the hospital as my bank card was drained of all funds. I was very upset when she made the mistake she ask me for more money. This place is a freaking joke big time. Stay away and I mean far away They will still your money. While I was standing in the lobby two crack heads where getting into a fight about who has to pay for the next rock, oh crap I need to leave however the hotel took my all of my money.

I wanted an inexpensive place for the night and this place fit the bill. That is about the only nice thing I can say about the place. Otherwise it was: 1. Dirty 2. Smelly 3. Walls need cleaning 4. I walked in flips flops in the room because the carpets were very dirty 5. Lots of traffics noise 6. Unsavory types hanging around property  In sum, avoid the place if you can. It is a very bad value for the money.

Non smoking room was full of smoke odor.  Marge (?) from the office did the best she could to clear that out.  We were not pleased with the lodgings.  For the region this motel most certainly needs updating.

We were staying in the hotel on 23.11.2013 for one night before flying back home from holiday in USA. Initially the room looks fine - just an average one from what we saw in other motels during the trip. Included breakfast also seems great idea. But with a closer look it is not that good at all - dirtry towels (I hardly found one with no spots), air conditioner smells badly while working, breakfast also mainly contains of pastry + bananas and oranges. Good thing is that Wi-Fi is included but still does not cost 75 USD.

We recently stayed at the Travelodge for 6 nights.  The hotel is decent enough for a place to rest your head if you're busy sight-seeing all day.  It isn't a luxury hotel by any means.  The hotel is also in need of some very much needed TLC.  The shower was very clean but you could see mold/mildew in the grout.  Some of the tile was coming away from the wall and the bath towels are very rough.  We also had to get new towels frequently because ones we were given had interesting stains on them or someone else's hair embedded in the towel.  The morning breakfast has a lot to be desired.  It doesn't offer really any healthy options.  The bed was comfortable enough the first few nights but by the time we left, I would wake up with a sore hip and a pain in my neck.  There was also
I stayed only one night and everything was perfect.  The room, the breakfast and the personnel behind the desk.
Very enjoyable experience! Friendly staff! Nice, clean and up to date rooms. First time in L.A. Area, will be back to your establishment!!

I chose this hotel because of the proximity to a wedding venue I was going to. The room was larger than expected but it was in extreme need of redecorating and updating.The deadbolt on the door did not work and we relied on the latch.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. Our side of the door could have used a good scrubbing or a "magic eraser". Our room faced the road so it was a little noisy.

I have stayed here before and was dissapointed that the room was not any cleanier than the last time.The location is great that is why I stayed the second time. I would like to see the carpets cleaned or replaced as well as the bedspreads both had bad stains.Also the bedding did not smell fresh the pillows had no protective covering just pillow cases.They did smell of other people...Kind of gross! I will bring my own pillows next time.

Summary Heading: Older hotel but the rooms were big.  Room was quite and...
Summary: Older hotel but the rooms were big.  Room was quite and clean, bed was comfortable.  Great value for your money.

Summary Heading: would not stay at this property again
Summary: first when we check in the remote did not work then the microwave did not work  heated a cup of coffee for two min. still was not hot. the beds were very hard. and their was black mold along the bottom edge of the tile of the tub and shower

Summary Heading: * Had to request additional toilet paper & blanket* New...
Summary: * Had to request additional toilet paper & blanket * New refrigerators has no freezer section at all
The very friendly staff and clean room did not make up for the over-priced room that had worn drapes (holes), very shabby furnishings, noisy environment and fan, and the "old room" smell .

It was very central to restaurants and things to do, so that was nice. However, the floor was so dirty, that even having our shoes off for a short while, turned our feet completely black. When I first noticed this, it did not down on me it could be the floor, but it definitely was! I was shocked - we kept our shoes on at all times, This made me wonder about the cleanliness of the whole motel, so I did not feel good about my stay.

Negative- Property is old and worn.  Carpet with burns.  Each day had a spider in the tub (must be spontaneous generation).  Chips, nicks on walls and furniture.  Breakfast without yogurt, waffles or a non sugar cereal.  Did have fresh fruit.   Positive- Friendly, accommodating front office staff.  Great pool and hot tub, well maintained.  Pool at deep end is 6 ft.  Good location, within a block of supermarket and tasty deli. Easy on/off freeway.  Housekeeping did great job each day on our room.  Ample parking. Air conditioner worked very well. Each room with small frig and microwave.  After several days there I didn't notice the chips and nicks.  I did enjoy our stay and would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Very friendly and nice kept up. Pillows r very soft and...
Summary: Very friendly and nice kept up. Pillows r very soft and thin..woke up with neck pain..but everything was good
Great location!  Easy to get to and easy to get back on the road.  Clean and friendly.  Good deal for the price!
Room had dirty wash cloths left on bed.  We stayed somewhere else on Friday, because we were not aware of increased weekend rates. .

This place is a dump!  Urine spots on the toilet, coffee cup ring on the bathroom floor, ants in the bathroom, NO PARKING!  I was so upset about the parking!  There was 1 spot left and someone parked crooked next to the spot taking up 2 spots. When I asked Marjorie the night clerk she said to park next door... Which ended up being down the street!  Upon checking in they ask for your license plate information and I asked her to look up the license plate and call to ask the guest to move but she never did, all she did was make excuses about how the guests always lie about their plates.  I was very dissatisfied with my experience.  I will never stay here again!

I would stay there again.  It is a motel that needs some cosmetic repairs (chair was ripped) but overall the staff was friendly.  Nothing fancy just your basic motel. Location is great could walk to stores and restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for your e-mail.  We appreciate your comments and will be using it to better serve our valued customers like you.    The Management

Summary: We arrived late and had some difficulty getting to the hotel. Even though it is visible from the road you cannot make a turn to get to it. Our check- in was easy and smooth. Our room had everything we needed and the grounds and building appeared to be in good repair. The room could use some updates.

The hotel is in the middle of a busy area (one way streets are confusing, easy to get lost), and it's shady, you don't feel safe. We didn't sleep both nights due to noise and people walking around who weren't even staying there. Some guy was pounding at our door at 2:40 a.m. until we threatened to call the police and he said he was looking for reception. Food was decent but roll away bed was sunken in and the supposed "non-smoking" room stunk.

There were a ton of problems with this room.  First off, the room smelled like cigarette smoke and the bathroom smelled like mold.  The lid on the toilet was cracked, helping out the general creepy vibe.  The stopper for the drain in the bathtub was broken and was obviously noticed by the staff because it was set out next to my soap and shampoo.  There was a dirty bikini top under the desk that I noticed when i went to plug my laptop in.  Finally, and this is nitpicky, but the tv on the wall was not even centered in the room and the wall mount didn't allow it to be angled to the bed.  That and there seemed to be endless foreign language channels and not a standard cable tv setup.  at least have a channel guide.  If that was the worst thing about the room, I wouldn't have
Aircon was too loud, room was dirty, u need to go to the counter if u need extra towel and the ceiling has stain idk if a blood or poop....etc!
It was a terrible experience. Room smelled like smoke, the. Like weed. We had to leave at 2am b/c the smell was unbearable!

Summary Heading: The room was ready on time, and it was exactly as described...
Summary: The room was ready on time, and it was exactly as described in the description.  The room was clean, and the personnel was accommodating.  The only problem we encountered was the parking.  There weren't enough spaces available.  I have a handicap placard and was unable to park anywhere close to the room.  Actually, unless you park early, it was nearly impossible to find any open parking spaces.

We booked the 1 bedroom apartment for my wedding. I had my whole family...7 kids staying there and me and my husband. Went to pull out the 2 pull out couches and neither had sheets or any extra blankets in the room. The mattress on the couches had blood stains. Asked for cover and sheets and was told we could only have 1 extra! Had to beg them for more! We needed the stove to prepare food for our wedding and none of the burners worked. The manager had to let us in the back office too cook! The Jacuzzi was a yellowish green color. Toliet kept not flushing After we checked out the only thing the offered was a $50 credit! The room size was the only thing that was good.

Summary Heading: My friend and I stayed as we went to the Alan Jackson...
Summary: My friend and I stayed as we went to the Alan Jackson concert. Location was great how ever the room was non smoking but pet friendly. I am a pet lover but we smelled cat urine through out the room need to clean carpets after pets stay.

We appreciated that the room was clean. The bed was comfortable. We were on a corner room right by the pool, so it was extremely loud, people were going in and out of the pool area all night, letting the gate slam behind them, therefore my fiance didn't sleep for maybe more than an hour each night. We stayed two nights. We did not appreciate the weed smell everytime we walked out of the room. We really only slept here, so it was fine for what we needed. We liked that the Triangle was across the way and had good choices of places to eat/drink, which we only went to once. We did not eat breakfast at this hotel or use the pool area, so we won't rate those.

Summary Heading: We really can't give a complete review. Got to our room at...
Summary: We really can't give a complete review. Got to our room at 8pm and left at 2:30 am. Room & bed fine.

Summary Heading: Staff was unfriendly and Drug dealers here
Summary: DO NOT BOOK HERE! I really wanted to give this motel some stars. When we first arrived the older lady at the front desk was wonderful and pleasant, she let me pick which location I wanted my room because there were some left. Got a decent room for the price; 2 Queen, fridge, microwave, and even a flat screen for only $109. The room was clean. The carpets were a little funky but that happens. Stayed the first night and the maid knocked in the morning to see if we needed service, I said no and to come back later, she said "okay". My husband went to go get some towels and a young, RUDE girl at the front counter told him in front of another guest that someone was rude to the maid and to not be. WHAT? REALLY? That just ruined our stay. There was no need for that and we were not rude.

Summary Heading: It is a very noisy hotel due to next to highway and poor...
Summary: It is a very noisy hotel due to next to highway and poor quality of wall/window. The internet speed is extremely low.

Over all our stay was pleasant... The only complaint's we had were that the carpet appeared to have not been cleaned in a very long time and there was a sheet of paper covering a hole in the ceiling where there must have been a water leak... Other than that, it was Ok for what we paid...

This Travelodge is in a good area for shopping and, of course, the beautiful Newport Beach area.  Proximity is a plus.  Unfortunatetly, when we checked in we were placed in a room so dingy and awful that we asked to be moved to a different room.  The new room was little better.  You know the floor hasn't been vacuumed when the previous tenant's sock is lying next to the bed.  But when you wear white socks across the carpet and they are literally blackened on the bottom, which I've never encountered before, you know the place is absolutely filthy.  We were scheduled for several nights but the management let us go early.  And that's why this place gets any stars.  The people running the place are very nice and, again, the locale is good.

Summary Heading: Hotel Bed was awful!!! Noise very loud and disruptive...
Summary: Hotel Bed was awful!!! Noise very loud and disruptive.  Staff was very unfriendly.  Free Breakfast was a Joke, food was awful.
Location is great for the beach and conveniently off 55 Frwy  Property is a bit older but maintened nicely with nice In room amenities. Quiet and comfortable rooms.  Would certainly stay here again.

This room was literally booked hours before we checked-in. Newport is typically pricey but we found this Travelodge with a fridge, microwave & comfy bed for a great price. It wasn't too far from the beach and happened to be next to a shoe store (bonus!). It turned out to be a great location close to food and some shopping. My two cons where 1. the water temp of the shower got a little wacky 2. The free continential breakfast was pretty heavy on the gluten (but like I said they had a fridge so we had our own GFree goodies) thankfully they did have hard boiled eggs. Overall, a great place to lay your beach weary head at night with a great location.
This hotel is very well maintained & the innkeeper & staff are awesome!  Very close to the beach & great accommodations!

This was the worst Travelodge that I can imagine. The grounds, buildings, and room was filthy and I mean really really dirty. cigarette butts everywhere, stains and spills on the sidewalks and stairs, kind of a funky smell around the room door. The room itself was dirty also carpet was nasty, tile in bathroom was loose chipped and the grout was stained brown, A/C cover was loose/broken, window had no screen, bed felt like it had been through the war lumpy and sprung with a definite sag to the left side. If our arrival hadn't been so late we never would have stayed we had planned 2 nights and only stayed 1. The continental breakfast consisted of cold cereal and micro muffins, the coffee was not fit to drink one sip and I poured it out. I'm 58 and I have to say this was the worst

Property is a bit older but nicely maintained. Room clean and spacious with in room fridge and micro. Easy access of 55 frwy. and minutes to the beach by car. Would certainly stay here again. Shopping and dining are everywhere around property.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to serving your accommodation needs in the future.  Have a great day!  The Management

Summary: Could use pressure washing of pavement; replacement of 'kicked in' outside air conditioning vent covers; Room 116 needs bathroom ceiling painted (advised management last 2 visits); issues with toilette running; cable TV needs English channels -- not sop many hispanic, Asian, middle eastern, etc.  bedspreads need to be washed.
Very good service, but I didn't receive the room I wanted (I put a request a front second room, but I got a room in a back)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for a great review.  We're sorry we were not ale to provide you with a room in your requested location at this busy time of the year.  We hope to have the opportunity to be able to do so in the future.  Have a very pleasant day!  The Management

Summary Heading: Nice place. Would stay here again.  There was some noise at...
Summary: Nice place. Would stay here again.  There was some noise at night from other guests.  The jacuzzi was not very sanitary.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for a great review.   We're glad you liked our hotel.   We welcome the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Have a great day!  The Management

Summary Heading: The employees couldn't have been nicer and more...
Summary: The employees couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating but the bathrooms looked dirty with black on the baseboards and grout.

Summary Heading: Clean room, great continental, great location!
Summary: this hotel is great for the price!! We walked into the room and it was nice and clean with a microwave and fridge. The pool is well kept and pretty(though not heated). The continental breakfast was perfect, bagels danishes, muffins fruit, coffee, tea, hard cooked eggs, juice, and the sitting area clean and attractive. The location of this hotel is awesome,plenty of places to eat, shop, and even catch a movie within walking distance. Close to balboa island and nice beaches. This is definitely worth coming back to.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for a great review!   We're happy that you enjoyed your stay and was happy with our hotel.  Our mission is to provide our guests with an excellent experience when they come for a visit.  We hope to get the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Have a very pleasant day!  The Management

Summary: We needed to attend an engagement picnic in this part of the city so we booked this hotel.  It is in a very good location but try to stay in one of the rooms off the road because of the street noise. Staff were nice and free breakfast was well stocked. They made sure food was always replenished right away. Our room was quite large, very roomy.

I stay here usually a few times a month and I must say Im never disappointed front desk is always pretty friendly all the rooms have been exactly whats been described looks like the pictures and always clean upon check in triangle square is literally a two minute walk away theres cheaper rms around the area but to me the location is worth the extra few dollars my only complain is that it could use better brighter in room lighting
Manager Response: Thank you for a great review!   We're happy to have you as a regular guest and are to you have always been satisfied.  We look forward to serving your accommodation needs again!   Have a nice day!  The Management

Summary: I had a really hard time finding a hotel down at the beach this weekend for a reasonable price. And rightly so. It was memorial day weekend and packed! Travelodge right off the 55 was the best I could do. Use to staying in Hiltons, I must admit I was no where near ecstatic about staying at a travel lodge. I used to stay in these hotels all the time when I was younger. The mindset being, you only need a place to sleep and keep your things while your out. Since staying at Hiltons, Ive gotten used to a certain kind of niceness (if that counts as a word).  Anyways, I am glad to say I would stay here again! The staff was really friendly and the room was much more than I expected. Good space, the beds were average. The location was not my first choice, but good enough for the weekend.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  It is our goal to provide guests with excellent accommodation at an affordable price.  We hope to be able to have you again as a guest in the future.  Have a pleasant day!  The Management

Summary Heading: Nice and clean Hotel, friendly people and great continental...
Summary: Nice and clean Hotel, friendly people and great continental breakfast. Thanks! Bathroom shower #214 needs tile work.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the perfect review!   We're glad you were happy with our hotel and enjoyed your stay.  Thank you as well for letting us know of the problem in your bathroom shower.  We hope to be able to serve you again in the future.   Have a nice day!  The Management

Summary Heading: We've stayed at this hotel a few times before and have...
Summary: We've stayed at this hotel a few times before and have always had excellent service and the rooms have always been clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel.  At Travelodge, we're always happy to provide our guests with excellent service coupled with nice clean rooms.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  We're eager to    have you again as our guest in the future!  have a pleasant day!  The Management

Summary: Hey! I hate to tell you how pleasant it is to stay here because i always want to be able to get a room.  I go to Costa Mesa Fairgrounds 5 times a year for Gem Faire and since i discovered this motel i really only want to stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel!   We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  We will continue to strive to make our hotel even better and we look forward to serving you again.  Best regards and have a pleasant day!

Summary: The room was QUIET, clean, and well maintained.  The hot water was hot and the in room 'fridge was cold.  There were NO SURPRISES!  And there is a grocery store a couple of blocks down the street so you can pick up real food vs. the other stuff that you find on the road.  Internet was fast and staff first rate.  What's not to like?
Manager Response: Thank you for a great review!  We're glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to the opportunity to provide you with the same, if not better level of accommodation on a future stay with us.  Have a great day!

Summary Heading: Favorite thing was the bed, very comfy and the room was...
Summary: Favorite thing was the bed, very comfy and the room was clean but the whole place looked outdated. Needs a good remodel. Good price and loved how close to the beach it was for the price.
I suggest, if you could change the carpet to wood flooring in your hotels.  Less maintainance and it doesn't smell like the carpet.
Thank you! We had a great stay at this Travelodge. The location was perfect for the OC Marathon. We were near some really good restaurant choices.
Manager Response: Thank you for a great review!  We hope to be able to serve you again in the future.  Have a great day!

Summary: To many visible stains on furniture...Smelled...towel was thin & rough...looked like they had a lot of rooms rented out to a transient  crowd.

Summary Heading: Don't stay in a front room!
Summary: We were first assigned a room (207) on the street side.  Heavy, noisy traffic and cheap single pane aluminum windows made the first night horrific.  The staff kindly assigned us to a back room for the second night.  Infinitely quieter.

Stayed again in a large one bedroom suite and again found it clean and attractive. Now it has a 50 inch HDTV. No freeway noise heard. Everything was in working order. Plenty of water for shower thanks to adjustable head. Bathroom small but adequate. Service of staff was excellent, which is unusual for this property. Walking distance to large number of shops and restaurants and short drive to beach.

For the price this was an excellent value.  The staff was great and the pool and jacuzzi were clean and well maintained.  The beds were very comfortable and the large flat screen was an added surprise.  I will be staying at the Travelodge in the future.
very pleasant vacation, easy access to freeway, shoping banks and restaurants, the new breakfast area a big plus

Worst hotel experience ever! Had a man try to enter our room at 7 in the morning! When reported to the front desk the receptionist acted like it was no big deal and wanted to just change our key! When asked why someone who didnt work there had a key to our room she had no answer. We checked out immediately and asked for a refund.. they would only reimburse us for the night we didnt stay.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Had a whole colony of ants in our bathroom, toilet wouldn't stop running, and our room was RIGHT by the highway, which made it a bit noisy.  Location was close to some shops and price was pretty cheap.  When I checked out and told the front desk lady that there were tons of ants in my room, she didn't seem to care much and didn't offer a discount or anything.  Would not stay here again.

There's no other way to describe than disgusting.  Even if it was $20 a night , it wouldn't be worth it. First off they gave me a smoking room, which I am highly allergic. I paid for 4 nights and the initial employee didn't offer any other room. The next morning I complained about how disgusting this room was so Claudia upgraded me to an "apartment" . Bottom line these rooms other than the TV haven't been upgraded at all since about 1970. You feel dirty just walking in. The walls, furniture, carpet, bottom of the bath are all filth... the plumbing is terrible. They really need a full remodel. Go stay at the modern motel 6 across the street.
This is the first time we saw the hotel run down. Shower was the worst. People making noise all night long. Floor and fixtures are in terrible shape.

Travel Lodge in Costa Mesa, Ca.  was the worst place I ever stay.  When checked in, I noticed our next door neighbor was loud and there were so many people in one room.  second, when we placed our " DO NOT DISTURB" sign on our door.  We noticed it was gone from our door when we left for dinner. Third, about 1:30 AM to 3:45 AM. The neighbor was loud and noisy. Its like they were having a party. It woke my family up while we were sleeping. I couldn't believe it.  Fourth, this is the one really pissed my family off. Around 4 AM someone kept knocking on our door. That is UNACCEPTABLE!

Summary Heading: The first night we had ants come and get into all my bags...
Summary: The first night we had ants come and get into all my bags. They switched my room everything was fine. We got a discount because of the ants which was good.  They had a good breakfast and the housekeeper was very prompt with helping our needs. The desk service was fair there were a few times when the desk was abrupt and kindof rude. The older lady was nice though.

I was initially a bit leery since the property was within 50 or 60 yards of the 55 Freeway. However, the room was unbelievable quiet. I was next to the pool on the ground floor and I couldn't hear a thing. The room was clean and roomy.   I've reserved for the same days next week and will probably stay there for most of the year. I even met a person who was delightful to talk with while having coffee and rolls (Continental Breakfast).

Summary Heading: Kudos to George, Pans to rooms
Summary: First I want to praise George, night manager.  He was very professional in taking acare of some problems with the room and with the neighboring guests.  The walls are VERY thin and the other guests could be heard very clearly which kept us awake two nights until very late.  The guests were not overly loud but the sound seemed to have no buffer.

It wasn't the best, but it did the job.  Rooms could use new carpet and updating.  Beds weren't very comfortable.  You could tell they put one of those memory foam pads on it. It's next to a busy highway, but it was very close to where we wanted to be and the price was right.

Summary Heading: Place was surrounded by homeless people and drug addicts
Summary: Our room faced a busy road with bright street lights. Constantly, there were people right outside our door using drugs. Homeless people slept just 10 feet away from our door and they came in at breakfast and ate the free continental breakfast. The queen beds were actually full sized beds, not great mattresses or pillows. The room had ants.

Summary Heading: Our room was nice and clean.  The bathroom was also nice...
Summary: Our room was nice and clean.  The bathroom was also nice and clean.  The only issue we really had was the breakfast.  Not much of a selection, so we ended up going out for breakfast each day, which was an expense we had not planned on.  Also, the television has a very limited selection of channels.  Other than that, the hotel was just fine.  Nothing fabulous, but what we expected for the price.  We would stay here again, although we would be prepared to eat out for breakfast!

At check in, no one bothered to tell us where our room was. I asked how much a cab ride would be from there to the beach and the guy at the front desk didnt know. Our room was right along the freeway, which was loud. The main light switch was burned out so we had to only use the light by the beds. While the room appeared somewhat clean, all three of us staying there woke up with bug bites the next morning and more on the second morning. The website stated the hotel had recently been renovated but nothing looked very new.

We live in Nor Cal and came down for an extended weekend to visit relatives that live near by, while I know that they are doing renovations which is fine, but i noticed in our room which  was  one the of the newly remodeled ones, I noticed in our bathroom that the ceiling had a air bubble in it, the drain for the tub had some gunk in it, and the switch for the lights should be replaced. We've stayed here before and it has always been pleasant. Rooms are clean and nice, a/c and heating unit work properly. The continental breakfast is nothing to rave about though, they have what looks like a breakfast room to serve the breakfast in with some tables and chairs and counterspace but they instead use the small cramped area of the front lobby.

Summary Heading: There have been improvements made at this motel since we...
Summary: There have been improvements made at this motel since we last stayed there. However, the free wi-fi did not work very well. The signal was not strong enough; my computer kept dropping the connection and I could not connect with my phone nor tablet at all.  The jacuzzi was nice and hot, which was enjoyable. Looking forward to their dining area opening and something other than packaged pastries and fruit being offered in the morning. That being said, we were wondering if perhaps our room had previously been a smoking room, or if someone had smoked in it; it smelled like it.

Summary Heading: OK location not far from beach or airport
Summary: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  The rooms need a little updating but not too bad.  Clean but not spotless.  Breakfast OK but needs a little more room for people.  Stayed first night of our trip and returned the last night due to location and price.

Have stayed here twice in 2010 and again in 2012.  The pool is great as is the jacuzzi and make up for the wuality of the room.  My stay here was enhanced due to the quality of the company i had with me, ie my mates.  Overall its a fine hotel for those travelling on a budget and is within walkig distance of the local bars.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review for our hotel.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  We continually strive to better our hotel and look forward to serving your accomodation needs again in the future.  The Management

Summary: The stay was very comfortable and close to the place I was visiting for a Dance Festival.  The personnel were helpful in helping me get to the hotel although rooms were not quite ready when I arrived.  It did not take too long to get the room ready and all staff were very helpful and friendly.   The buildings are apparently under remodeling.

Summary Heading: HORRIBLE STAY AT TRAVEL LODGE, BED BUGS & BAD SERVICE
Summary: Not sure where to begin.  The property itself was filthy -- owners do not keep property clean.  Requested non-smoking room, and place in a room which reeked of smoke. Second room had bed bugs and filthy.  Moved to a third room and the heat did not work -- again it was filthy.  Third room was also dirty -- dirty bedding, dirty walls and filthy carpet.  I will be calling the health dept.  Moved upstairs, could not lift luggage and was informed I would receive assistance the following day to carry down luggage.  Fought with desk clerk to get assistance with carrying luggage to downstairs.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on our hotel.  We're sorry you chose to post inaccurate comments about the hotel simply because you were unhappy you were asked to vacate the room after we've been more than patient with you staying more than 2 hours after the check-out time.  The hotel is clean and the room does not have bedbugs and in fact many other people have stayed in that room without any bedbug complaints.

Summary: The jacuzzi was hot, our room was nice and clean with a microwave, fridge, flat screen tv and the king bed was so comfortable we wanted to bring it home. Thanks, I'm sure we'll see you again sometime.

A friend and I stayed here for two nights in September while attending a music festival. Rooms are fairly basic, but CLEAN and just what we needed to rest our heads for a couple of nights. Our room looked out onto the pool from the ground level and wasnt noisy at all. We used the laundry which was also very clean. Service was very friendly at the front desk.  The only thing MINOR thing was that the Coke machine had no drinks in it at all! But I realise that this probably isnt to do with the hotel, but an outside vendor.  Easy access to the Newport area - a good bargain stay in The OC!

The staff was friendly and the room was cheap, location was ok. At first they assigned me a room on the second floor, but because there was no elevator I requested a room on the first floor. The room on the first floor did not work out because the lights in the bathroom and closest to the beds were not working, there were also ants all over the bathroom area. The next room they gave me on the first floor had an unpleasant odor and ants in the bathroom and the bedroom. It didn't seem like requesting another room was going to change the fact that there are ants in every room. I've encountered less ants on camping trips.  I was so uncomfortable i only slept in the room and avoided going back to the motel until absolutely necessary, i kept my bags in the car and didn't even sleep in

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in
Summary: Room was mediocre. Location was horrible. Room fronted major freeway and the traffic and noise all night kept us awake. My advice fins somewhere else to stay. We had got into town late with no reservations on a short notice trip so we stayed here. What a mistake that was. Room had no weather stripping along the side of the front door so cold air rushed in all night. same with window. window was cracked and broken. would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

The bathroom was over run by ants. The television was fixed to the wall and was not adjustable to the room and station reception was very poor or non-existant on 5 channels. Check in was good and quick staff was friendly.
Hotel was nice and clean.  Furniture could have used a little upgrade.  However, I felt safe, and secure while I was there.  The staff & housekeepers were very nice as well,
Ants infested the whole place,had to hide our snacks in the microwave.in everything and ALL the rooms

Even though the room was non-smoking it still smelled pretty bad. The lock on our door wasn't working and even after the manager spent an hour changing the battery on the door for the key card to work it broke again after an hour so they had to break the window for us to get our stuff and move to another room. I specifically asked for an adjoining room when I made the reservation but when we checked-in they said they didn't have any.
Ok for what we needed.  A place to stay after wedding reception at Turnip Rose. But probably wouldn't recommend for more than one night. Generally unattractive place.

The "breakfast" left a lot to be desired. However, the staff person on the desk was very helpful when my coffee machine in the room didn't work. Also, the decaf in the room was actually decent but no decaf with the "breakfast".

Had an issue with Bert that morning, doors were locked at time of opening, saw us opened doors didn't say anything he went right to the back room without asking us if we needed anything which we did. An animal had dug a hole on the hotel grounds in the middle of night which threw mud all over are freshly cleaned car as we were going to a wedding, finally when burt decided to give us some of his precious time he seemed like he could careless no apologies we given he simply said he would send maintenance and of course they never showed up! so I had to fill the bathroom trashcan up several times and dry with the bathroom towels to clean my vehicle off.

Every bo9dy was very nice, thw maids was very helpful, the only thing was the breakfast was a little, on the weak side, it could have had more fresh fruit. Everything else was great. I will be coming back in the future. thank you, RONNIE FACTOR

Summary Heading: We were very impressed, excellent service, employees super nice,  I could notr ask for anything more.  We will be back..
Summary: Excellent service, we were impressed with the service, great employees.  We injoyed the stay.  Some kids had a party one night and they were loud....
Not a fancy overpriced hotel, But the best value in the area. Have stayed there before and I will again.
it was in a nice area i enjoyed everything about it and will come back.. also will recommend it to friends and family

Summary Heading: Don't get a room in front
Summary: I was in room 106, facing the street and end of the Newport Freeway. Lots of traffic noise into the wee hours and starting again before dawn. Then there were the people above who stomped around until after midnight. The pillows were useless so I bought some of my own. The continental breakfast was pathetic. The toilet wobbled. I reported it but nothing was ever done about it in the five days I was there. TV channel offerings were very limited, though there was HBO in English and Spanish. (Other similarly priced hotels in the area offer far more. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and the water pressure was good. The tub had the type of faucet I like that lets you find the temperature you like then just push and pull it onn and off. It's a short walk to restaurants and

We were not expecting too much since the price was so low for the area, but were pleasantly surprised.  The room was large and very clean and SUPER quiet.  We had been warned not to expect too much from the continental breakfast, but it was okay.  Donuts, danish, juice, coffee, oatmeal, etc.  Worked for us!  If you are short on funds and need a place in the Newport Beach area, that is very clean and comfortable, we would recommend this place.

Location was operfect close to Newport Beach. Room s was clean big Flat screen TV . Beds were a little outdated that was the only negative. Pool was clean and well kept up. I would stay there again for the same price. Good value
I had stayed there before and found it to be clean, nice and conveniently located. I think that more channels should be offered on tv.

Location: while the property is close to Newport Beach area, getting to it is very tricky. The hotel is located on a frontage road parallel to highway 55 and exactly at the point where the freeway ends. So, getting into the hotel has you darting across lanes just to make it. Staff: friendly, but took them a few discussions amongst each other to figure out how to process my reservation. Room: dirty, old, smelly. A/C unit was loud, lighting was dim, and the room looked empty, as if they've removed furniture and not replaced it. Amenities: don't believe the "free breakfast", it's watered-down coffee, old bread, and some kirkland juiceboxes. And the vending machince (onely 1) only had soda, no water. Had to drive to the nearest gas station to get water.

We have stayed at this hotel twice while attending "Cruisin' For A Cure" at the OC Fairgorunds. The first stay, Travelodge had lost our reservation but Front Desk employee was very gracious in honoring our reservation from the printout that I had with me. Our room was very clean, great location & had no problems at all. The pool & jacuzzi were great after a long day setting up things at the car show - even when a drunken guest jumped off the second floor walkway into the pool, hotel staff responded immediately due to safety concerns. We whole-heartedly recommend this hotel to friends & associates who will be staying in that area.  We will also be staying here this September for the "Cruisin' For A Cure" car show as we will be working it again.......

Nothing fancy here, but a simple, clean, fair priced and good location hotel. OC during the summer can be very expensive. This is a good deal. Not sure what all of the negative reviews are for. We had, probably, the worst location (faced main street, freeway offramp and on first level) and it was still fine. Rooms face the old main street, which was bypassed when the freeway extension was finished. AC hum eliminated in street noise. Office left the pool open for an extra 45 min to accommodate late arriving guest and restocked the simple breakfast in the morning, on a regular basis. Bus stop in front of hotel if you want to use public transportation to head to the beach rather than hunt for parking spot.

Rooms are clean, but need major renovations. Doors don't work properly, ceiling looks like it is caving in, and it was very noisy. I would have been more comfortable sleeping in a van down by the ocean.

Summary Heading: How a Hotel Steals your money off a Credit card and nevers give it back.
Summary: I stqayed at this rotten hole where the help was a joke. But the most important thing is they debit from my credit card amount orf $201.21 and never told me about it. When I asked them about none of them didn't know anything about it. I asked them to check their computer , they say it just floating around and didn't know why. I checked out on 4/20/2012. And have called them many times where is my mony you stole from me. But when your dealing with stupied foreigners they always lie to you. Don't ever stay at this rotten hotel or they will debit your credit card and will not tell you about it. I am planning to take them to court because of this.

Summary Heading: Okay place to stay for a night
Summary: Little hard to find at first, but the staff is pleasent enough.  Large room, hot coffee in the morning, all in all would stay again.

We booked this hotel because of it's proximity to my nieces wedding. It was 2 miles away and we needed to be close. Upon checking in we found the room to be old, stale, and in much need of a total rehab. The airconditioning unit was broken and pieces were on the floor. The door lock was secured with a rubber band. There was left over food and wrappers under the bed. Need I go on. The place had an all around bad feel to it. We ended up staying at my sisters house and counting it as a loss since we had booked it on Expedia. Would not reccomend this hotel.

You get what you pay for in this room and a little more. While you won't get a big breakfast you will get enough to fill you until your next meal. For the price you get a nice large clean room and a large 40 in. mounted TV. While a little older all was well taken care of. We stayed 3 days and our room was always cleaned and cared for. No problem with the area or getting around. Pretty close to food and movies and most importantly the beach!

This is an old favorite that has been kept up well. Stayed in a one bedroom suite that was clean and  attractive. Everything was in working order, including kitchenette. It's walking distance to restaurants and easy drive to the beach.

Summary Heading: Great room then not so much after all.
Summary: Seemingly pleasant start of stay with an easy check in and a big bed and room, though the room faced the major thoroughfare and highway exit to Newport Beach.  The police pull-over show was an all night experience in front of my door/window.  The pool was chill and the hot tub was oddly foamy, but it was okay.  The Svenhardt breakfast and strong coffee w/ donuts and more is good.  The flat screen tv in the king room the first day had a bad signal on most channels so it negated the size.   It should and could be better, but it may be good, for the price, most times.  Great place for base of all exploration SoCal and LoCal, and that trumps all.  Be Careful out there in Newport and HB travelers.

Apart from the tiny lobby with no seating for breakfast & not enough chairs for the table in the room to eat what they serve as a continental breakfast, this motel is not too bad. We stayed several nights and were put in a room on the second floor with the window facing a wall. It is 3 miles to Newport Beach so we didn't complain about the nonview. Breakfast: coffee or tea, juice boxes, wrapped Danish, oatmeal, toast, fresh fruit, donuts. No where to eat it except for couch in lobby. Beds are comfy. Towels are slightly rough. Pool is not heated. Jacuzzi works. A/C was quiet & efficient.

Summary Heading: "OK" Place for the Money in California
Summary: I was leery in staying here after reading the reviews, but they were from the hight of the bed bug contoversy. I was glad to note that this place was very clean and NO BUGS!  The microwave didn't work and the light was inadequate but for a place to sleep. the price was alright  There's a large fence around the pool so you don't have to worry about the kids wandering around it. The pool is small though, and three kids would make it crowded.  It was hard to find coming off the freeway from John Wayne Airport, so you have to watch out for traffic. It was AAA appoved and a nice 2 Star property

I am a National artist and stayed here due to a friend.  this place is a complete rip off. Beds are horrible, rooms are smelly and worst of all is the customer service when you have a complaint.  They charged way more that what they said and when trying to rectify the situation with the manager, I could only speak to him on the phone as he was late for work, and then he completely ignored me and the GM still to this day has failed to even call and have a professional conversation. If they could do this to someone like me I could imagine how getting an issue resolved would play out with a regular guest.  I make lots of money and understand you get what you pay for. however, i do not expect just because prices are down that customer appreciation would be down also. I would never

The room was large and  clean.  The bathroom was a bit dated but generally ok.  Breakfast if you can call it that was marginal at best. The grounds were reasonably clean and well  tended.  A nice large flat screen TV, but no comfortable sitting furniture in the room.  The last night of my four night stay, there was an unruly group of youths in a couple of rooms next to mine making a lot of noise after 10 PM.  It took me several calls to the front desk to get the problem resolved.  I could tell the front desk people really did not want to deal with the problem. I believe they finally kicked the noise makers out, so I was satisfied with the resolution, it just took a bit longer than it should.  The hotel is about 2 miles from the beach, so for $50/night it is a good value.

Summary Heading: Great Value and Location for Costa Mesa area
Summary: I needed a room for 4 nights for a conference in Irvine, and got this hotel through Priceline.  I got a great price for the hotel, but was a bit wary after reading the negative reviews.  However, I found that the room was everything that I needed.  It has a fridge, microwave, and big screen TV.  I found that the bed was quite comfortable.  It was clean and didn't see any bed bugs.  They don't have wireless, but they provide you an ethernet cable to connect to the Internet for free. As mentioned in the last review, if you are looking for a 4 star experience, you won't find it here.  If you need a good value room to stay, and close to everything (supermarket within one block, the beach in 10 min drive, then I would recommend this hotel.  I personally enjoyed staying here.

Summary Heading: Great valus, very good room, excellent and friendly staff
Summary: There are a gazillion, maybe more, $100 to & $300 and up a night rooms in an 8-miles radius of this motel, but unless you plan on hanging out in the hotel 24/7, why pay it?  There were no bedbugs.  NONE, and when they had bedbugs it was during the world-wide/nation-wide infestation of them.  The rooms are clean and well kept, but it is an older place so if you need to be dazzled, then this isn't for you.  The entire staff was wonderful, but I name Susie, Claudia, and Michael, because I got to know them a little.  I reported trouble with my electronic lock and Michael diagnosed the trouble as the lock and replaced it WITHIN one hour of my report.  The motel was full every night, yet quiet and peaceful.  I was visiting friends and family and needed a good place to sleep, shower,

After reading previous reviews, it looks like they still haven't fixed the problem!!  Horrible. We actually ended up bringing the bed bugs home and the whole "trip" ended up costing us over $900 after all of the defogging services, washing everything in hot water etc.  Only after I made a huge issue about it, the mgr was nice enough to refund my hotel stay. AND only after I told her I had pictures. Horrible...do not stay here.  Also, it is a very noisy place and very "iffy" people were there when we were. Will not go back.

I was a little skeptical as I booked this hotel after reading the negative reviews. I thought for $50.00 a night I would take my chances. The hotel was not bad at all. It is an older hotel, but the room was clean. My coffeemaker didn't work so I left a note for housekeeping and they promptly replaced it with a working coffeemaker. The guest laundry had issues as there were two washers and two dryers but one of the washers didn't work. You didn't find that out until you get to the spin cycle then it didn't spin so was left with wet clothes. other than that, great location.
Staff was unfriendly and belligerent. Room was nasty. Filthy drawings inside drawers. Red stains all over the carpet.

Summary Heading: Great Price, Great Location, Great Room
Summary: I read the other reviews before booking here and took the chance knowing that i'm not a fussy type of girl. I stayed at the travelodge with my boyfriend over the weekend friday-sunday knowing it was close to the galaxy theatre (where i was going to be friday night) and had nothing but a great time. The Staff was nice when i checked in and i also got a free upgrade to a suite :) Couple stains on the carpet but nothing to complain about. it was a clean room at a fair price. nice pool, decent complimentary breakfast. It's also easily located right at the end of the 55 fwy. and right down the street from the beach. i would recommend anyone to stay here and will definitely be staying here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Ok for 1 night to get a sleep after a long flight
Summary: hotel was easy to find at the end of the freeway, check in was simple, as was the room and breakfast! WHich was served in reception. Not ideal with children. The room was clean(ish) mainly very dated. I would have been distressed if we were spending longer at this hotel, but was a 1 night stay after landing at 7pm in LAX so was ok.. For 1 night only!

Hotel was nasty. The rooms smell so bad they leave ALL the room doors open to air out during the day. Hotel was basically empty yet they put us on second floor right on freeway - normally I don't have a problem with noise but it was Extrememly loud. Carpet was sticky...was afraid to walk around barefoot or sleep in nasty beds. Advertises free wifi, but doesn't mention it's available in office only - which doesn't open until 7:00! Failed to mention that as well. Went into office and manager was carrying on a personal conversation with staff member so loud we couldn't hear each other - had to leave. DO NOT STAY HERE - GROSS!

Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place. In the middle of the night we realized that our bed was crawling with bed bugs. Management did not seem to care much about this sanitary problem. The room was overall quite disgusting, sticky carpet, not very clean sheets, lots of spider webs etc. For just one night I would have put up with that...however, not with bed bugs. I got my money back from hotels.com but I still I wish I had never sat my foot there. No I just hope I haven't brought any of those bugs home with me ...we'll see in a few months...

Great location and clean rooms. The staff is very nice and always willing to help. The pool area is very nice and the pool side rooms are convenient. Many places to eat within walking distance and a movie theater close by. Will be back during the summer when we head out to the beach.

We chose this hotel to stay at through Travelocity. We only stayed one night since we were in the Laguna Beach area for the Festival of Arts and Pageant of the Masters. After a long day at the festival, we headed off for our hotel, both pretty beat, and looking forward to a comfortable, relaxing sleep. We get there and number one, we were given a smoking room. When we booked our reservation, no where did it ask us if we wanted a smoking or non-smoking room, so we were stuck with the stench all night. The bed was low to the ground, old, and squeaky. The bathroom had ants in it. The carpet was dirty and stained. And I didnt even dare to sit in the chairs that were provided in the room. The upholstery was practically black from years of never laundering or upkeeping it. I would

My husband and I stayed at the Travelodge 6/8-6/11 for a wedding.  We chose this hotel because it was right next to the Turnip Rose and the church.  We drove from Arizona but wanted to be able to walk to the wedding/reception.  The hotel is average and clean.  It is what I expected from a Travelodge plus a little more.  I don’t think this was a busy weekend.  There were always plenty of parking spaces.  The rooms were spacious.  Nothing too fancy, it is a budget hotel.  It was sometimes a little noisy because to shut the doors you had to almost slam them so we heard people coming and going sometimes.  The noise wasn’t anything that would bother me, I just noticed it.  It was within out budget, $77-84 per night.  We had a small couch and table along with a king sized bed, a nice

Mildew smell in room from carpet. Very noisy. Could hear guests through thin walls. Every other room smoking, so non-smoking rooms smell like smoke that seeps in through very thin walls. Lack of parking for guests. The only thing good was the location and the price.

While traveling to Newport Beach I stayed at this Travelodge. Normally I would stay with a larger brand but this place looked so charming and inviting that I decided to pull in and check them out. The young lady at the counter was very helpful and friendly. With the reasonable price offered, I decided to give them a try. I found that the rooms are extremely clean and well furnished with many ammenities. Every member of the staff that I dealt with seemed to be well informed and trained, and all were very knowledgeable when answering my questions. Located just minutes to many trendy beaches, where lodging prices can be a bit extreme, I felt that I definately got a great value. I will return again and have no doubts that I will receive the same service and value. Thank you,
Awful room with water soaked carpet and noise from the 55 freeway.  Useless staff, and my car was broken into parker in the Travelodge lot.  Avoid this place!!
